dialogues.text: Alice, a heavy bag slung over her shoulder, and her boyfr RICHARD (30's, scruffily handsome in sweats and a coach's jersey), carrying three binders and a bag of baseball bat exit the school among a crush of students. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got practice until five thirty, then I'll be by.

dialogues.text: Hey, Meg! Bon voyage! Alice offers a binder to Meg as she arrives at Alice's ca

dialogues.text: I finished our travel binders! Meg takes the binder, looks it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me again why we're taking phonebooks to France? Alice gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love my binder. I do.

dialogues.text: Where's Emma? She knows we're meeting, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgot her purse. (watching the students)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, for the first time in a long time, I feel just as lucky as  any of these kids. They may have their whole lives ahead of them but we've got a week in Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's right. I keep forgetting your life is completely over. So sad. I'm really going to miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that was a close call! They turn to see Emma. crossing the parking lot holding a quality knock-off designer handbag over her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at her. The only teacher in Racine County that wears four inch heels in six feet of snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She always looks great, doesn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My passport was in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you find it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second floor girl's bathroom. Right where I left it. This

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, binders! Great! Alice passes one to Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys were so nice to ask me to come with--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma, we're a team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just be sitting around the condo, trolling e-Harmony...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fact that you have trouble finding a date--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, it's this town!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gives me less than no hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what we should do, Meg? When we're over there? we should all treat ourselves. Find a real salon. Total spa treatment. And I'm gonna get my hair done. Just like this! She holds up a European tabloid she's pulled from her pur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stabbing a finger at a photograph: CORDELIA WINTHROP SCOT (30's), a blonde heiress deflecting paparazzi in couture. NOTE: EMMA and CORDELIA are Played by the same actress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at us. Meg and Emma turn to Alice, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're really going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice's passport and a brochure emblazoned with a logo: Esprit de Corps Tours, sit on top of her dresser, next to framed photo of Alice and Richard at the Wisconsin Dells. Alice struggles to close the overstuffed suitcase on her tugging at the stubborn zipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... Please... please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The zipper tears away from the suitcase witha loud RIP! i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg pulls a well-worn stuffed dog from her open suitcase the couch, holding it up to her daughter, FINN (6) who we a spangled tutu and cowboy boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to see Paris, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn, if Edith goes to Paris with me, she can't go to Daddy's with you. Finn's brows come together as she considers this, then reaches for the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seamus! SEAMUS, Meg's ten year old son, pounds down the stairs carrying an enormous backpack as Meg zips her bag closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toothbrush? Seamus makes a face, drops his bag and heads back up the stairs as the doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLENN (30s), in a police uniform, watches Meg squeeze her children tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember. Gameboy goes to bed when you do. Nine o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seam, why don't you take your sister to the car while your mom and I talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get on the radio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. Meg watches her kids run to the squad car parked at the c just as KARYN (30's, also in uniform) emerges on the passenger side to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And no lights!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Meg! Meg lifts her chin in greeting, but that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I uh... I heard from my lawyer. She said you'd signed your papers. Meg watches her kids climb in the car with Karyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess that makes us official, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me? (a nod to the car) Or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me, Meg. A beat as they look at one another, hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! Seamus reappears, charging up the walk to pull Meg down t his level, hugging her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma's packed suitcases stand neatly arranged by the door the sparsely furnished, undecorated room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 S.

dialogues.speaker: ANSWERING MACHINE
dialogues.text: You have no messages. Leaning on the lip of the kitchen's bar, Emma presses the record button on her answering machine, then speaks with put-on, coolly sophisticated,'jet-setting accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. You've reached the home of Emma Lindgard. I'm afraid I won't be able to return your call right away, as I'm currently traveling. In Europe. But, please, do leave a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ". .She was known as 'The People's Princess'... Emma turns at the counter to see Princes Diana touring an African encampment with children on the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh! She hangs up the phone and sits herself down at the coffe table where a game of solitaire is laid next to a microwa Lean Cuisine dinner. She turns up the volume with the remote and gathers the cards, shuffling. Eyes glued to Princess Diana on television, Emma suddenly shoots her hands three feet wide, rifling the cards in perfect vertical formation like a seasoned cardsharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice opens the door, kissing Richard who holds up a suit in one hand, a bottle of champagne in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special delivery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice zips the suitcase shut and raises her arms in victo as Richard pours the Champagne into two glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! I am good to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard brings a glass to Alice, nuzzles her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you, you know. Alice takes her glass and presses Richard down onto the b climbing on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Christmas when I was a kid. There's no way I'm going to be able to sleep tonight--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for me. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, how long have I been talking about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm... You were reading Colette. In the teacher's lounge. First time we met. Long time. Alice pauses as this lands somewhere deep inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels like it. They clink glasses and Richard watches Alice tip her glas back then stop mid-sip to peer down at the delicate diamo ring sitting at the bottom of her glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Richard... It's so... It's beautiful... Richard takes her glass and fishes out the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, we can't even celebrate--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? We're

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I'm leaving. I'm--. I'm getting on a plane in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I want to make sure you come

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops, sobers) Wait. You're serious. Are you serious? You're serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do this when I get back. In a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, listen, it's just the timing. I wasn't planning on this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. I planned tonight. Tonight was my plan--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's great. This is great. You're great. But, Richard, I feel like I just need to do this one thing first. Then I can do the next. Then I can do this. (off his silence) Can you understand? There's a world I haven't even seen yet... Alice, hopeful, searches Richard's inscrutable expression beat, then he turns away and gets up, ring in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we'd be seeing it together. (pockets the ring) Have a great trip, Alice. He heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, come on. You're leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking back) Maybe I'll see you in a week. Alice listens to his footfalls and the slam of the front door, then falls back on the bed, striking her head on th open suitcase, wincing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentleman, we are about to begin our descent into Charles de Gaulle International Airport...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg sleeps in an aisle seat of the dim coach cabin where the window shades have been drawn down, Emma dozing besid her, a game of cards laid out on her tray table.

dialogues.text: Alice brings her seat to the upright position as instruct and sits, hyper-alert, looking at her closed window shade A beat. She reaches out and raises the shade a tentative crack, flooding their row with light. She glances furtively around the cabin, then inches the s higher, drawing in a sharp breath at what she sees. She flings the shade up. ALL OF PARIS is laid out below her; a magical nautilus-li wheel with the Eiffel Tower as its central axle. Her breath steams the window as she drinks it all in. She turns, eyes full, to Meg who cranes across Emma to sh in the view and squeeze Alice's arm with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we there?! 0

dialogues.text: Merci .

dialogues.text: Well, that's great! ALICE

dialogues.text: You're not going to be a problem, are you?

dialogues.text: This is ridiculous... EMMA

dialogues.text: Can you believe? They're from St. Paul! On their honeymoon! CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waited a long time for this! But, we finally made it! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, that's like you! (back to couple) We're here celebrating my friend Meg's divorce! 0

dialogues.text: Alice, Meg and Emma race past gallery after gallery, tryi to keep Madame Valery's little blue flag in sight as it f over the crowd in the distance. Alice whipsaws her head at everything they're missing, ma notes in her guidebook on the fly. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, I'll e-mail it to you. Meg looks up, catching Alice eyeing their surroundings. MEG

dialogues.text: (re: Mona Lisa) At least she's smiling. ALICE

dialogues.text: (snaps to, smiling) What? No. I'm--. I'm just a little tired. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a happy idea)

dialogues.text: Hey! I'll bet you have jet lag! We'll probably all get it! Meg raises a glass of wine. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To jet lag. Emma and Alice raise their glasses to toast as WAITERS pl down identical plates of steak frites before them. MEG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Alice. Best organizer. Best guide. Best friend. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Alice! They clink glasses and Alice is suddenly jostled, just as she's about to sip, by Carl as he turns from the table be her, spilling her wine. DEEDEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Carl!  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 16. CONTINUED: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so sorry! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mopping her front) IT'S OKAY-- DEEDEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was just looking for the catsup- CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not using it. As Emma passes the bottle of catsup, Meg offers Alice her napkin, and waiters sweep their plates away, replacing th with creme brulees. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! No. Wait. Pardon, Monsieur-- CARL (RECEIVING CATSUP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merci! He turns now, catsup in hand, to blink at the creme brule that has replaced his own and Deedee's steaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice places a hand on Madam Valery's arm as she passes. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon, Madame, but... Madam Valery slowly raises her eyes from Alice's hand. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you apologizing? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've taken our dinners away-- Madame Valery taps her watch and then her clipboard. MADAME VALERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were stragglers at the. museum. Now, I am behind schedule. 0

dialogues.text: Esprit de Corps tour members disembark from their bus in front of a comically narrow and vertical Baroque hotel wi its name in feeble buzzing neon: Le Petit Sommeil. ALICE (PRE-LAP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! Look at this picture and tell me what's different!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women lower the travel brochure and its photograph of tidy well-appointed suite, to regard the actual one in wh they stand; dingy, impossibly small, crowded by an armoir that nearly meets the low sloping ceiling, with two spind twin beds and a military-style cot. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toujour le suck-ez vous. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I researched at least a million TOURS-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. This is the one we could afford. A beat as they consider the room and their lot in life. MEG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only five nights-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five nights? Here?! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, Alice, you said yourself, we'll hardly ever be in our room. (SELLING IT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be like camping. At Eagle River. It'll be fun! Emma opens what is essentially a closet with a toilet. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your outhouse, Meg. Go nuts. Alice joins Emma at the bathroom door.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 18. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Me? I'm going to try to hold it. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Emma. Let's just unpack-- she turns for the luggage, nearly falling over at the wei of Emma's suitcase as she reaches to lift it. MEG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy--! Alice, help-- Alice climbs onto one of the beds to help Meg lift. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma, what have you got in here? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the stuff you put on my list-- (off her look) And a couple options. The bag slips from Meg's grasp, crashing onto the foot of bed which collapses, catapulting Alice onto the cot which flips up over her, knocking Emma into the tiny bathroom.  EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Come on, guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice gazes out a window that opens onto a narrow alley a the ugly backsides of buildings, as Meg and Emma sleep fitfully behind her. She looks down at the cellphone in her hands, scrolling through her speed dial to stop at: 1. Richard. She hesitates with her thumb over the "call" button. She turns back to the miserable view, considering for a b then folds her phone away as she blinks back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame Valery leads a diminished flock, bobbing her staff with its blue flag, in a forced march across the span of ornate pedestrian bridge toward the waiting tour bus.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 19. CONTINUED:

dialogues.text: The Pont des Arts has it's name for the vast number of art students that come here to paint this famous city view... Meg and Emma, the worse for wear, trail Madame Valery at distance with Alice who now leads her own handful of tour members, Carl and Deedee among them. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called the Pont des Arts because the Louvre was formally known as the Palais des Arts... Madame Valery stops ahead, turning back to take in Alice her cluster of appreciative followers. MADAME VALERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People! We must keep together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice's group circles an inscribed stone medallion with a star-shaped brass inset on the pavement outside Notre Dam  DEEDEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Point zero. Dez roots dee France." ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from right here that all the highway miles in all of France are measured. They also say that if you stand on this exact spot, you are be destined to return to France in the future. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm in! Come on. Everyone! Together, they all step forward, arms entwined, laughing. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a picture! Of all of us! Alice looks up as Emma breaks away, to see Madam Valery leading her dwindling group from the great church. Madame Valery sends her charges to the bus, then heads straight for Alice as Emma tries to enlist a JAPANESE COU to take a group photo with her camera.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 20. CONTINUED: MADAME VALERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My head count was short in the cathedral. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I was explaining about POINT ZERO--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame Valery sizes Alice up and taps her staff as the gr forms around them, joined by the Japanese couple. MADAME VALERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This flag? I do not carry it for my pleasure. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were just on our way inside-- MADAME VALERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now you may head to the bus. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, we haven't been-- MADAME VALERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is why you must follow my  flag! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: okay. We will. I promise. But, these people haven't seen the CATHEDRAL--- MADAME VALERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are many churches on the tour. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, this is Notre Dame! They need to see this-- MADAME VALERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assure you, they will see everything they need to see-- ALICE (LOSING IT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what's the point if it's all a big fat blur? When nobody can see anything properly? Let alone experience it, or appreciate--  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 21. CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: MADAME VALERY
dialogues.text: You seem quite the Paris expert, for someone who has never been. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ill bet she knows more about it than you! The Japanese wife frames the action with Emma's camera. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might not have ever been here before, but... (EMOTIONAL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've waited my whole life for this trip. CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've waited thirty years-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell her, Carl. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep rushing us through, like this is some kind of race-- (REALLY HURT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you won't even speak French with me. (SGUARES HERSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I think I've been very nice. We're from Wisconsin. But, I'm telling you, I am not getting on that bus until my friends and I have seen Notre Dame. Meg and Emma exchange looks as Alice plants herself with folded arms and steely resolve before Madame Valery. MADAME VALERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps, if Madame is not satisfied with my tour she could conduct her own. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd she say? Alice's eyes narrow in regarding Madame Valery and all fa silent a beat; a crowd anticipating fireworks. CLICK! The Japanese wife snaps a picture of the standoff, the sound of the shutter triggering Alice to action. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 22. CONTINUED: (3)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With lightning speed, she seizes Madame Valery's flag.  CROWD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Madame Valery, nonplussed, reaches out to reclaim her fla but Alice jerks it further away, while the Japanese woman snaps picture after picture. DEEDEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, we're getting on the bus! Madame Valery lunges for the stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus pulls away, revealing the Japanese couple who ret Emma's camera with a bow, Meg, and Alice holding the flag EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fantastic! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "A" plus! Alice, cheeks flushed, watches Carl waving goodbye from t 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bus's rear window. MEG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, you okay? Alice brings the staff down across her knee, snapping it two, casting the broken ends into the gutter as she raise herself to her full height. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, the real tour can begin! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's kick this town's ass! Alice marches forward as a few drops of rain fall. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's starting to rain-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares? We're in Paris! What's a little rain? 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water pours in sheets from the sky as Alice, Meg and Emma splash down the Rue de Rivoli and duck beneath the shelte the hotel's canopy. They shake water from their arms and hair, pluck at their sopping clothes. PHOTOGRAPHER 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia! They glance over at a few PAPARAZZI sharing the protectio the overhang on the far side of the entrance, as a camera flashes in taking Emma's picture. Emma smiles, blinks, confused as another photographer admonishes the first. PHOTOGRAPHER 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wasting your film. That's not her. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're they saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice looks about in equal confusion, but stops short whe she sees the opulent restaurant behind the window's glass ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Meg and Emma turn to gape as well at the DINERS and elega tables inside as the rain hammers down. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, mes aims, is Paris. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they'd let me use the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg and Emma step into the lobby, a palatial world of mar gold and flowers, as Alice confers with the DOORMAN. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. 0 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 24. CONTINUED: ALICE  (TO DOORMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merci. (joins Emma and Meg) Okay, Emma, it's down the hall to the left. Meg and I'll go and get us a table-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet you in there. Emma heads for the ladies room, gaping at the lobby. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow... MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get us a table? Alice, we can't afford to eat here-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My treat. ME G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't afford---  ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hooking Meg's arm) We're going to do one thing right in Paris. I don't care how much it costs. They turn for the dining room, passing the front desk whe CORDELIA WINTHROP SCOTT (dressed similarly to Emma, thoug ten times the cost) unleashes her ire on the CONCIERGE. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, just how do you propose I am to travel tomorrow, then? CONCIERGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sorry, but, there is nothing-- A MANAGER enters from the back. MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle Scott, I have checked and there is no sign of a package--  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 25. CONTINUED: ( 2) CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvelous. I'd like to see someone who speaks English, please. If there is such a person in France. The concierge and manager look to one another and back. MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not English we are speaking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma swings through the door into the black marble bathro grabbing a towel to swipe at her wet hair. She stops abruptly, examines the towel. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are cloth! She takes the towel into one of the stalls, closing the d behind her just as Cordelia strides in, stops at the coun CORDELIA (ACID DISGUST)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: France. Cordelia's cellphone RINGS! and she pulls it from her pur

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello? CORDELIA (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would not believe these people. So rude! She takes her phone into the stall next to Emma's and clo the door just as Alice and Meg enter.

dialogues.speaker: CORDELIA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: And they wonder why none of us do Paris anymore! What I've been through--. And, Daddy is being PERFECTLY HIDEOUS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Meg look at one another in the mirror, overhear Cordelia, as they pick up towels to dry off.

dialogues.speaker: CORDELIA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: He's making me go to Monte Carlo! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 26. CONTINUED: ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (0. S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: CORDELIA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I don't know. Some auction. One of those foundations--. But, have I heard from them? No. And they were to take care of the plane--. Well, I'm certainly not going to go if, Wait, where are you? (LISTENS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reykjavik? Would I need a coat? A toilet flushes and Cordelia opens her stall door, heads the counter, oblivious to Alice and Meg who freeze with t towels, blinking at her uncanny resemblance to Emma. CORDELIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know if there's an evening flight--? Alice and Meg turn to each other, then to Cordelia's reflection in the glass, their mouths hanging open.  CORDELIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, I think I can just make it. No. I won't even check out here. It's better if everyone thinks I'm being a good girl and taken the trip down to-- Cordelia stops when her eyes snag on Alice and Meg. CORDELIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me call you when I get to the airport. It may take awhile... She gives Alice and Meg a devastating look up and down. CORDELIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears to be raining outside. Quite hard. She picks up her purse and exits without looking back jus Emma opens her stall door and joins Alice and Meg, who ga at her with towels in their hands. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see those are cloth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Emma, I mean, exactly like you. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she sounded awful. And kind of mean. Alice, Meg and Emma, punchy and a little drunk, enjoy win from enormous glasses as they finish their meals. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (draining her glass) She should be ashamed. Can you imagine having a room here and then not staying in it? An ANXIOUS WAITER races in, refilling Alice's glass. EMMA (PERFECT MIMIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling, I was thinking of ordering this entire menu, and then not eating it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter retreats, joining FIVE others standing at discreet, fearful attention, all careful not to look at E whom they've clearly mistaken her for Cordelia. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should just take it. Her room. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And her trip to Monte Carlo! (TO ALICE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's still France, right? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, how fast can you get a binder going on a trip like that? ALICE (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'd love to see that. Us in Monte Carlo. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so funny about that? We got in here.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 28. CONTINUED: EMMA  (MIMICKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed. It is pitiful how low the standards here have fallen. Two waiters step in to clear plates, hearing all. EMMA (CONT'D) (MIMICKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me to have Daddy buy this hotel so that I can knock it down. Alice and Meg laugh with Emma as the waiters head for the kitchen in panic. WAITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to other) She is a monster! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma, you could be her! EMMA (MIMICKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling, Meg. Always making me laugh! (DROPPING IT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who in their right mind would ever believe that I was-- MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon, Mademoiselle Scott? The three look up at the manager in surprise. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. Were we being too loud? MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, we are all very happy to see Mademoiselle Scott smile... A WINE STEWARD hustles up to the table with an ice bucket stand and a bottle of Champagne. MANAGER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. In apology for our earlier misunderstanding. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our misunder--?  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 29. CONTINUED: (2) MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dinners as well. With our compliments... The three women exchange glances as the steward begins to open the bottle and the manager bows, backing away. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Monsieur? MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui, Mademoiselle? Emma smiles, broadly, batting her eyelashes as the stewar pops the Champagne cork. EMMA (PERFECT BRITISH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I so hate to be a bother, but I seem to have misplaced my room key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK! The door swings open into the dark room, framing t three drunk laughing women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice fumbles for a switch, hitting the lights, and their laughter cuts abruptly at the sumptuous interior of gleam marble, gilt and silk. ME G HOLY-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scheize. Alice sees but one the thing: The Eiffel tower illuminate on the other side of a bank of French doors. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A view! There's a view. Alice races to push back the window sheers, revealing a staggering panorama of the city, the Seine, and the Eiffe tower in the pouring rain. The entire city of light is reflected in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Now this is more like it!  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 30. CONTINUED: MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's whole other room in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice enters, steering around a tower of Louis Vuitton luggage, as Meg pulls a fresh bottle of Champagne from a bucket of ice. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. What are you guys doing? Emma launches herself onto the enormous bed. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the room we were supposed to have! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On what planet? Come on. We were only going to take a look! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we're looking. (pops the Champagne) And we like what we see.  ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg! Meg takes the bottle and crawls up with Emma. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, take a break, would you? We WALKED EIGHTY-POINT-FOUR-SIX-SEVEN-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: two kilometers... A lot happened today. ALICE BUT-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pats the bed) Alice, how many do chances do we get? For something like this? Alice considers, looks out the window at the streaming ra ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. But, just until it stops raining. Then we go.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 31. CONTINUED: MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (makes room for Alice) Agreed. Alice climbs up and together, the three pass the bottle o Champagne as they study the ceiling's ornate plasterwork. MEG (CONT'D) (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I just keeping thinking of the look on that woman's face! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad I got pictures! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did surprise her-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised me! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really loved that flag, didn't she? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Carl and Deedee...  EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think that if you sleep in a bed like this every night your dreams are different? Alice rolls to her side and the view of the Eiffel tower. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like, are they bigger? You know? Do you dream a more amazing life? Meg kicks off her shoes, lets them drop. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... We'll never know. Seen from the bed, the light atop the Eiffel tower breaks through the dissipating clouds to swing a searching arc through the night sky... MATCH DISSOLVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Eiffel tower gleams gold and orange in the morning su 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A telephone rings, stirring Alice. It rings again. She reaches for it in her sleep as Emma sits up groggily beside Meg curled around the empty Champagne bottle. ALICE (ANSWERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it? Alice's eyes fly open as she snaps awake. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Yes... EMMA (SHAKING MEG)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg, wake up. We're in trouble-- Meg pulls herself up, sees Alice on the phone. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shiii-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be right down. Merci. She hangs up. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were only joking! We didn't mean to--! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll tell them it was a mistake! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia, your car is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, Meg and Emma attempt to conceal themselves behind Cordelia's tower of cases as it's wheeled from the elevat by two PORTERS.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 33. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women scurry for the exit past the desk manager. MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle Scott! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep moving. The three women increase their pace, but the manager catc up to them with an express envelope. MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle Scott, this came for you this morning. The package you were seeking? Emma merely blinks at the offered envelope. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it. Just take it. EMMA (SNATCHING IT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks again! They break for the door, but the manager follows.  MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid there may still be some PHOTOGRAPHERS OUTSIDE-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they emerge, the manager and doormen hustle Alice, Emm and Meg towards a waiting car and driver, as paparazzi ca and shoot from across the boulevard. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much but I think we'll WALK-- MANAGER (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, you can not walk to the airport. ALICE (STOPS FAST)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airport? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 34. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, as Emma and Meg look to Alice for direction and t frenzied calls of the paparazzi increase.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. It's fine. We'll just have him drop us off... Alice and Meg look out the back window at the manager who waves them farewell, the doorman shooing photographers. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They really do think she's her... RIP! Alice and Meg spin to Emma as she spills the envelop contents. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I want to know where we're going. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going back to our hotel-- Emma holds up an itinerary with a big mischievous grin.  EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We're going to Monte Carlo! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We're not. MEG (TAKING ITINERARY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see that-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, what's "prive?" Is that like an airline? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma, for crying out loud. Meg, you want to help me out here? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on... I'm reading... EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? Meg wants to go. Don't you, Meg? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 35. CONTINUED: ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Meg, doesn't. Meg looks up from the itinerary, shrugs. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trip's paid for, whether that girl takes it or not. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! And somehow that magically makes taking it right? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the worst that could happen? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can think of a lot of things-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in charge. You want to go back to that hotel, okay by me. A beat while Alice looks between Meg and Emma, trapped. MEG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally your call. EMMA (FULL-ON CORDELIA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, darling, we'll completely understand if you feel we shouldn't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car drives across the wide stretch of runway on a trajectory for a waiting private jet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women swivel around in their plush seats at the POP! cork as a STEWARD opens a bottle of Champagne. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. We go. We take a look around. We get on a train and come right back...  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 36. CONTINUED: MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything goes wrong, we say it was a language thing, that we didn't UNDERSTAND-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I like that idea, because it's true! They fall silent as the steward appears with glasses of Champagne, wait for him to retreat. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, look, come right back. It's a good plan. Alice, Meg and Emma clink glasses. MONTAGE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The steward helps the women from the plane, where another UNIFORMED MAN waits on the tarmac to escort them further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their escort opens a door ahead of them to a roof deck, w spilling in to the stairway they climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge onto the deck, Emma squealing and grabbing Al when she sees their waiting helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, Meg and Emma delight as the helicopter banks along coast, the Mediterranean glittering in blue and green bel A craggy ridge falls away and all of MONTE CARLO unfolds step upon step of coral rooftops, cream and gold. END MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, Emma and Meg step from a limousine, blinking in th bright sunlight to take in the square in front of the hot its fountain and the adjacent casino.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 37. CONTINUED: ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! What do we want to do first? Check out the palace, or the beach? MEG EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beach! Palace?! ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's find a map-- JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle Scott! They turn as JEAN-PIERRE MICHAND (late 30's), sophisticat in jeans and a sportscoat but with a warm bohemian air, c down the steps, an oversized envelope tucked under his ar EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, bon jour me. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made it! I was getting a little frantic--. When I did not hear from you--. So I sent your TRAVEL--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs at himself) But, you are here. (off her blank look) Forgive me. Jean-Pierre. Michand. With the foundation-- He pauses in shaking Emma's hand as his eyes land on Alic with friendly curiosity, a charge. JEAN-PIERRE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome--. I---. I didn't realize you would be bringing-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry! This is Alice Perry and Meg Kelly. Two of my dearest friends. Visiting from America! ALICE (SHAKING HANDS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Jean-Pierre has trouble pulling his eyes from Alice as he shakes Meg's hand. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a pleasure to meet friends-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 38. CONTINUED: (2) EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll say. Emma sneakily indicates Jean-Pierre's empty ring finger t Alice and Meg as he consults his wristwatch. EMMA (CONT'D) (WHISPERED ASIDE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ring. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm terribly sorry, but, I am already late for a meeting-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't keep you-- JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to make sure you arrived safely and that I was here to greet you. (AN AFTERTHOUGHT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. And, of course, to deliver your invitations for the week, and the foundation's report--  EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Invitations for the week--? JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various events. Leading up to the AUCTION-- (THE WATCH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, I am so sorry, but, I am reluctant to keep His Highness waiting. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His Highness? JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prince. But, we will see each other at the casino for tonight's game. Please, bring your friends-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are very generous, and we'd love to, but, I'm afraid Cordelia has other plans this evening-- Jean-Pierre turns, charmed by Alice's perfect French, and alarmed by this news. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 39. CONTINUED: (3) JEAN-PIERRE BUT-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're very sorry-- JEAN-PIERRE (MOUNTING ANXIETY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps we have misunderstood each other. Mademoiselle Scott--. She must be there for tonight's game. The prince. His Highness has asked to be seated across from her-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he saying? Which prince? Jean-Pierre looks imploringly between the three. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. It is for the foundation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within a glossy brochure: A collage of "snapshots" shows happy African children grouped outside their new school; raising their hands at their desks in a pristine classroo finding their country on a glossy globe. ALICE (ANGUISHED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, would you look at these kids? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't. I can't stand it. Emma reads to Alice and Meg from the brochure in the seat area of their luxurious suite, enjoying none of it, nor t incredible balcony view of Monte Carlo's marina and bay. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "With your help The Michand Foundation is able to sow the seeds of education, transforming lives, families, and villages, one child at a time..." She didn't say anything about a school! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schools, with an "s." More than one.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 40 CONTINUED: ALICE  (MISERABLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Africa. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That horrible, irresponsible girl! I've never stolen a thing in my life, now I've taken a trip from school children. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Africa. Meg hangs her head. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reykjavik! That takes some nerve! They're counting on her for a charity auction and she doesn't even show up! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only she did. Emma reaches for a gigantic wrapped fruit basket. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not touch that! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, Emma. If you're Cordelia. They've seen you. You're here. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't go to that thing tonight. (A BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have anything to wear. The phone RINGS! and Emma snatches it up before Alice can EMMA (CONT'D) (PERFECT BRITISH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Alice gestures for Emma not to say anything, to hang up.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 41. CONTINUED: (2) EMMA (CONT'D) (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, please. Send it up... Um. Yes, all of it. Everything. Thank you, ever so. Merci! She hangs up and holds a beat before turning to Alice. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My luggage is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Meg stand in front of the tower of Louis Vuitto trunks and cases while Emma idly thumbs the combination l of a steel briefcase in her lap. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. But, just for tonight. And, that's it. CLICK! Alice and Meg look to Emma, holding the now open briefcase, eyes wide. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky guess? 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A necklace of diamonds and enormous yellow stones sparkle like a constellation from within the case's velvet lining ALICE (CLOSING IT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No jewelry. Emma nods. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it.all goes back. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dry-cleaned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gaming hall's towering ornate doors are opened by TWO DOORMEN for Alice, Emma and Meg to make their big entranc Cordelia's couture chiffon, silk and organza. Heads held high, backs straight, they strike a remarkable tableaux as they pause in unison at the top of the room's raised landing to survey the swirl of roulette wheels and tony European jet set. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 42. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first glance they look spectacular, but under closer  scrutiny one can read Meg's composed discomfort in wearin dress that is too tight, nearly spilling her breasts, and self-consciousness Alice endures in a dress made daringly short by her height. But, this is because we know them; to all other eyes they only belong here, they own the room. They glance at one another, eyebrows up: "We're here!" EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you feel like we've won something already? Jean-Pierre comes to greet them with PRINCE DOMENICO DA SILVANO (30's, movie-star handsome), both in tuxedos, offering a hand to escort Emma down the few steps. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle Scott, you made it! Emma withholds her natural smile, placing just the tips o her fingers in Jean-Pierre's palm with exaggerated hauteu EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enchante.  Jean-Pierre assists Meg and Alice, Meg clutching the top her dress, Alice anxiously keeping the skirt of hers in p with a hand as she steps down. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Mademoiselle Margaret Kelly and Mademoiselle Alice Perry-- (FOR ALICE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am very glad you were able to come this evening. Alice nods, blushes and tries to cover. JEAN-PIERRE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I present His Highness, Prince Domenico Da Silvano? Prince Da Silvano bows from the waist. DOMENICO MADEMOISELLE SCOTT-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, call me "Cordelia."  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 43. CONTINUED: (2) DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you will call me "Domenico." EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shall certainly try. Domenico escorts Emma out onto the casino floor as Jean- Pierre touches Alice's elbow. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we? Alice and Meg allow Jean-Pierre to lead them, following E as GAMBLERS break from their games to track these three elegant women gliding smoothly through the room. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside to Alice) I may as well be topless. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I'm mooning everyone behind us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DEALER unseals a new deck of cards as Domenico pulls ou chair for Emma at the room's enormous game table. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but, I really wasn't planning on playing this evening. I so much prefer to watch-- Emma looks to Alice and Meg for help as Jean-Pierre leads them to the far side of a low railing to view the game. DOMENICO (A WINK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This I do not believe about you. He turns to the eight other PLAYERS (of various ages and genders, but all rich) clustered at the room's small bar. DOMENICO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen? Shall we begin? The other players make obligatory introductions and take positions at the table as Jean-Pierre offers Alice and Me tall upholstered stools to sit.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 44. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice moves to sit, but then remembers her skirt, looks t Meg who is unable to even raise a leg in her tight dress. ALICE (TO JEAN-PIERRE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easier to see if we stand. Jean-Pierre hands them both a glass of Champagne. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why aren't you playing? JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. I play behind the scenes. Like Robin Hood, I take from those who have more than enough, for those who have nothing but need. (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, I do not play because I have no money of my own. Alice smiles, charmed by his candor, but then stops. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're playing for money? (turns to Meg, flat) IS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're playing for money. Together they turn to see Emma happily arranging the card she is dealt in her hands. DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia, why don't you do us the honor of setting this evening's stakes? Emma glances over to Alice and Meg who look back at her, ashen, and turns to the players who smile expectantly. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Um. Okay... She takes her handbag into her lap, opens it, looks. EMMA (CONT'D) (A GUESS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Why don't... Why don't we start at ten? A shocked player sputters into his drink. Emma places a twenty Euro note on the table.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 45. CONTINUED: (2) EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is if anyone is able to make change. A beat. Jean-Pierre, Domenico and all the other players burst out laughing and Emma smiles, laughing too, but shoots a desperate look to Alice and Meg. DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvelous! He signals an ATTENDANT over as Emma's shoulders relax. DOMENICO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please bring Mademoiselle Scott a rack of chips. (TO EMMA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred? EMMA (BIG GULP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. Sure. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would not know it, but she is very funny. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A riot. Domenico casts a glossy chip into the pot. DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle Scott starts us at ten thousand a hand. Alice and Meg freeze, their champagne glasses sliding fro their hands, while Emma's eyes grow as large as all the zeroes on Domenico's chip. DOMENICO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be feeling very lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEALER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle Scott? It is your call.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 46. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma sits locked in a cool stare-down over the top of her cards with Domenico across from her at the tensed table. Meg downs a glass of Champagne in one gulp, snagging the of the WAITER's jacket, hauling him back for a refill. The waiter turns to Alice, who pats at her face with a da napkin, struggling to breathe. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes bottle from waiter) I should probably keep this. DEALER (PRODDING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle? Emma places her cards face down before her, appears to fo EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... She moves her hands to the stacks and stacks of chips bes her, and pushes them to the center of the table. EMMA (CONT'D) 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all in. The other players gasp and Alice fails to suppress a whim as she grasps Meg's pouring hand, spilling Champagne, dra Jean-Pierre's attention. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I'm just--. Excuse me. Alice slips around the railing and heads for Emma as two players fold in near tears, leaving just Emma, Domenico a DOWAGER (60's) in the game. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm terribly sorry to interrupt. But, Cordelia, you look a little overheated... Why don't we--? (WHISPERS LOW)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Have you completely lost your mind?  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 47. CONTINUED: (2) EMMA (WHISPER BACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Don't distract me. I'm in the middle of a hand-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma! That isn't Monopoly money! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. I've got it under control-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this isn't the mathletes finals in Kenosha! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Pierre, would you be a dear and get Alice some water? (TO ALICE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one that got us into this--! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will see you, Cordelia. Domenico pushes his own mountain of chips to the pot in t center of the table and Alice buries her face in her hand when the dowager folds her cards. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper to Alice) Now, go sit down and try to be cool, would you? Jeeze! Let me handle this. Alice moves back to her stool, tries to smile as she take the water Jean-Pierre offers. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd she say? What'd she say? ALICE (SICK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going down, Meg. Going down hard. DEALER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle. Your Highness. Your 0 cards, please. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 48. CONTINUED: (3)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Meg turn helplessly to the game table. DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies first. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you. Please. Domenico can hardly contain his gloating as he reveals hi three aces. DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am very sorry, Cordelia. A beat, then Emma shrugs. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. It is just a game after all. She turns her cards over and fans them on the table felt: royal flush in the suit of hearts, ace high. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do hope there are no hard feelings. The other players cheer as Domenico's smile crashes. Emma shrieks with delight, turning to Alice and Meg who g each other, barely keeping themselves from pitching over, glasses spilling, as the other players applaud. Emma rakes in the Everest of multi-colored chips with bot arms, laughing as she's congratulated. DOWAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must play often, Miss Scott. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, a little, online. But, this is so much more fun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domenico and Jean-Pierre, each toting buckets of chips, escort Alice, Emma and Meg to the elevator, all giddy. DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even a last drink in the bar?  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 49. CONTINUED: EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been such a splendid evening, I am reluctant to press my luck any further. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Good call, Cordelia. DING! The elevator arrives and the doors open as Domenico leans in towards Emma. DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you must promise to dance with me at my party tomorrow. Emma evades Domenico by stepping onto the elevator. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Delmonico-- DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Domenico." EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would not miss it for the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg collects the buckets from Domenico and steps on. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great meeting you, your Highness. Good times. Really. Jean-Pierre places his buckets in Alice's hands, a certai frisson to the simple exchange. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow night? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Before Alice can respond to Jean-Pierre, Emma takes one o the buckets from Alice and hands it back to him. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must keep this one. For your foundation. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, your family has already been SO GENEROUS--  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 50. CONTINUED: (2) ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She really believes in education. The doors start to close. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, then. DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, welcome to Monte Carlo. The doors close, leaving Jean-Pierre and Domenico to gaze fondly where the three women had just been. They both sigh and turn for the bar, when they hear shrie from the elevator as it rises above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, Meg and Emma jump up and down, screaming like girl a slumber party, chips flying everywhere. MONTAGE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, Meg and Emma burst through the salon doors into th street, their hair color richer, eyes brighter, a new lightness to their step; vivid, brilliantly polished vers of their essential selves. Heads turn as they set out together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wings of a brass-framed three-way mirror spin and spr in a swirling kaleidoscope of shifting reflections: Alice, Meg and Emma work their way through an increasingl spectacular and audacious series of combinations, dresses gowns, modeling for each other as they are tended to by SHOPGIRLS and SEAMSTRESSES... --Alice twirls in a navy dress with white polka dots. --Meg slaps her own ass with a laugh, admiring herself fr the back in a pair of pencil thin sexy black jeans. --Emma glows in a pale lavender strapless satin gown. END MONTAGE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, Meg and Emma watch as a number of their dresses ar boxed and a CASHIER writes them up. SHOP GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like these put on your account, Mademoiselle Scott? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Thank you, we'll be paying CASH-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, it would be darling if you could have them sent round our hotel. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. You know what, on second thought, I'm not getting these-- She pulls the pair of jeans from her pile of clothes. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, they looked amazing on you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was I ever going to wear them? Seriously? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wear them here! Anywhere! Alice, you tell her-- Alice opens her mouth, but stops herself as the three wan the crowded market stalls heaped with fountains of flower every color, breads, fresh produce, trinkets and souvenir ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm not going to tell you what to do. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. It's silly, anyway. They're just jeans. I want to find something for the kids-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Meg! Look! For Finn! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 52. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma leaps to one of the stalls, seizing a profusion of  plastic jeweled tiaras displayed alongside photographs of Princess Grace. She places a tiara on her head, modeling. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How perfect is this?! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even better! Alice holds up a pair of pink satin toe shoes, swinging t from their ribbon laces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOP OWNER (60's) slips a pair of freshly polished men' shoes into a paper bag, placing them on the counter in fr of Richard, who pulls out his wallet. RICHARD (REMEMBERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. And the suitcase. The shop owner retrieves Alice's mended suitcase from a nearby shelf, a tag on the zipper.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How much do I owe you for that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard exits the shoe repair carrying Alice'.s repaired suitcase, headed for his car. GLENN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Richard! Richard glances up to see Glenn crossing the parking lot Seamus and Finn, pushing a cart piled high with groceries CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard finishes helping Glenn and the kids transfer groc bags to the open trunk of Glenn's squad car. GLENN (CONT'D) (CLOSING TRUNK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we'll see you at seven then-- RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's two with sausage, extra sauce, no onions--  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 53. CONTINUED: SEAMUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thin crust. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it. Richard picks up Alice's suitcase. FINN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to France, too? RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I just-- Glenn turns, noticing the suitcase for the first time. GLENN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Hold on! You're going to surprise Alice--? FINN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love surprises! RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No, I---  GLENN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man, I win! Richard blinks as Glenn claps him on the shoulder. GLENN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg and I've had this bet going: She thought it would be on Alice's next birthday, but I knew it was going to be this trip to France! RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenn, listen-- GLENN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry! I won't blow it for you! I won't call anyone, ruin the SURPRISE-- (PLAYFUL PUNCH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sly dog! You've probably booked the best suite in Paris. Am I right? Got the ring, the whole show--. This is so you!  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 54. CONTINUED: (2) RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused, but flattered) So...me? GLENN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure! That's why Alice loves you. You get how much this trip's meant to her; now, you're just putting the icing on the cake. The big gesture, you know? Not too dominating: Supportive. Loving! (shakes his head) You're the man, Richard. Big props. Glenn pulls Richard into a big happy bear hug. GLENN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenn. She said, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNARD ROCHAND (late 30's), an appealing Frenchman in a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sportscoat, pauses in collecting leeks when he spots Meg the other side of the open stall. He watches as she surveys the rich array of fresh produce lifting a tomato to her nose, inhaling with a private smi Meg bites into the tomato, spurting juice onto her cheek down her front. She looks up as she attempts to wipe the juice away, stop when she catches Bernard smiling with amusement. Meg rolls her eyes with self-deprecation and moves on alo the line of stalls. Bernard pays for his purchase and follows, finding Meg at another stall where a FRENCHWOMAN tries to communicate ho prepare the fish they both admire. Meg nods, not entirely understanding, but getting enough it to gesture responses. The woman grabs some newspaper, wrapping the fish, and thrusts it towards Meg with a smile.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 55. CONTINUED: MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. No. I'm sorry. I'd like to. But... The woman is confused, vaguely insulted. MEG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a kitchen. No place to cook. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is only a visitor. Without a kitchen. But, it is a beautiful fish. Maybe next time. Meg turns to find Bernard beside her. BERNARD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have explained. Meg hesitates uncertainly before this friendly stranger. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you... She smiles at the woman and starts to walk away, only to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernard falling into step with her. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are American. Meg glances at Bernard and away, uncomfortable, but curio drawn by his warmth and the familiar greetings he exchang with various vendors as they walk. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Wisconsin. Yes. Bernard reaches a handkerchief from his jacket for Meg. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cook in Wisconsin? Meg uses the handkerchief to blot the remaining tomato ju MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try. But... We don't have even half of this at home. She points to a tray of miniature lobsters.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 56. CONTINUED: (2) MEG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like those. I've only seen them in magazines. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, langoustines. Many ways to PREPARE THESE-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd go for a saute, being a Midwestern gal. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Court-bouillon. MEG (IMPRESSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poaching. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With sea water. Amazing. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you cook. Bernard dips his head modestly.  BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you say, "I try." (offers his hand) Bernard. Rochand. Meg shakes his hand and returns the handkerchief. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg. Kelly. Thank you again for YOUR HELP-- BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, how long are you in Monte Carlo, Meg? Meg's brow furrows slightly and she turns to head back. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to find my--. . My friends are around here somewhere... BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will help you find them. We can WALK TOGETHER--  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 57. CONTINUED: (3) MEG (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. It was nice to meet you-- BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Bernard." MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But, I'm gonna walk myself. Thanks, though. She slips into the moving crowd, leaving Bernard to watch she meets Alice and Emma further up the street. He holds a beat, then turns when called to by a vendor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenn paces as Richard holds the phone at his desk, the Esprit de Corps Tours website on his computer's screen. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been two days and it didn't occur to you to call anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame Valery, cellphone to her ear, leads'the few remain members of her flock down the wide steps, across the Sein from the Eiffel tower. MADAME VALERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She refused to follow my instructions. She sabotaged my tour. Ruined it for everyone! RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Alice did? Alice Perry? MADAME VALERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She took my flag! CUTTING BETWEEN: RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, if their luggage is still there, then they're missing-- GLENN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missing? What the--?  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 58. CONTINUED: RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I get in touch with the police? GLENN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm the police! RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the police in France? MADAME VALERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police? Monsieur. Nothing could keep her from seeing Paris her way. Believe me. She was very determined. RICHARD BUT-- GLENN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she saying? MADAME VALERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are the husband, yes? Richard hesitates, looks to Glenn.  RICHARD (FIRMLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I am the husband. Glenn nods emphatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cascade of yellow and gold balloons washes over Alice a she dances with Meg and Emma to a Euro-trance-pop beat at center of the crowded dance floor. Emma screams with delight in a new dress and plastic tiar batting balloons as Domenico who spins her away. Alice watches with heightened vigilance as Emma dances wi her prince and blows a kiss to Alice and Meg. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, she's fine... (MARVELING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look where we are! Can you even remember the last time we danced like this? It's gotta be-Martha Lapland's wedding--  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 59. CONTINUED: ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, sometimes Richard and I go to Madison's on Saturdays-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops dancing, laughs) The gay bar? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
