dialogues.text: (shrugs, matter of fact) They've got the best music. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so butting in on that. Alice laughs and spins, crashing directly into Jean-Pierr JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I was looking for you! From the edge of the dance floor, NIKOLAI LUDOVIC (late 3 squat, bald, completely nondescript but for his white tie tails, watches Emma ardently. He stops a waiter, taking his tray of Champagne flutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma spins to find Nikolai at her elbow, grinning, holdin this offering, and she takes him for a waiter. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh! Thank you! I'm so thirsty! Nikolai remains planted, holding his tray with a smile, watching with bright eyes as Emma drinks. She lowers her glass and her full attention snags on Niko really registering his presence now as she searches his w gentle eyes. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a wonderful party, isn't it? Nikolai nods and offers her another glass of Champagne. Alice, dancing with Jean-Pierre, subtly repositions herse in order to keep an eye on Emma. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia, she can take care of herself, yes?  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 60. CONTINUED: (2) ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Oh, yeah, of course... Meg dances by herself, having a great time, taking in the room, the music and the people, when a handsome MAN begin match her moves, insinuates himself. She smiles but shakes her head as she moves away, turning back to evade him. Another gorgeous MAN sidles up to Meg, joining her solo dance, wiggling his eyebrows invitingly. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks. She moves off only to be met by GIORGIO (40's, sexy, Euro suave) who smoothly steps in. MEG (CONT'D) NO-- GIORGIO (GRINNING WIDE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Giorgio!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma slips away from dancing with Domenico, moving to Nik who remains with his tray at the ready,.brightening at he approach, lifting a glass. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you need to, like, circulate? NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya znal, chto naydu tebya. Emma blushes as though showered in compliments. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? PENELOPE (FLAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia Winthrop Scott. Emma turns, still smiling, to find PENELOPE PENROSE (late 20s, British), frail and bird-like, but attempting to hol warrior's stance with her shoulders thrown back. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 61. CONTINUED: (3) PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you not know who I am? Emma's smile falters as she glances furtively about. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. 'Course I do... Hi. PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penelope. Penelope Penrose. Penelope's chin quivers as she reads Emma's blank look. PENELOPE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent a year in hospital-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hospital? What happened?! PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did! You happened! Alice swivels around at the raised voices, spots Penelope facing Emma. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me! She dodges away from Jean-Pierre, hooking Meg's arm in passing, yanking her away from Giorgio as she heads for E PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pretend you don't remember! Third year at Le Rosey! You threw my luggage in the pool. Set fire to my mattress. You cut off all my HAIR-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? That's awful! PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While I was sleeping EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did that to you? ALICE (CORRECTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia! How could you?  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 62. CONTINUED: (4) PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was just the first night. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say you're sorry, Cordelia. (WHISPERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And let's get out of here! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, no--. Wait a minute-- PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alice and Meg) she turned all my friends against me... They had to send me away... To live with the nuns-- Emma grabs Penelope by the shoulders. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you listen to me, Penelope Penrose. You have no idea how long I've waited for this moment. Penelope flinches, preparing for a beating.  EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I had no way of finding you after you left us, and...Oh, Penny. Don't you see? Don't you know that I was just jealous? Alice and Meg exchange looks. PENELOPE (SMALL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jealous? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were so smart. So clever and BEAUTIFUL-- PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was ugly-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Penny. I was ugly. I was a monster. PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penny Pignose. That's what you called me--  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 63. CONTINUED: (5) EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, I knew I could never compete! Not with anyone as special as you. PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought I was special? Emma looks at Penelope, nods emphatically. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know what I've waited for all these years, Penelope Penrose? Penelope shakes her head almost imperceptibly. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To do this. Emma opens her arms wide and pulls Penelope into a hug. She looks at Alice and Meg over Penelope's shoulder, and closes her eyes with genuine emotion for a beat, pulling to smile into Penelope's grateful, tear-streaked face.  EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now... Friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising a glass) To friends! old and new! Emma seizes Penelope's hand from across the table, placin in Domenico's as she drunkenly sings the old Girl Scout s EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Make new friends and keep the old, one is silver and the other's gold!" Alice and Jean-Pierre lean toward each other intimately' across the packed, lively table of PARTY-GOERS. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, no one really lives here. Monte Carlo. It's like Hong Kong. People merely come and go. People like me. Well, and then, people like yourself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 64. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice nods to a WAITER who arrives to refill her Champagn glass, pouring as Jean-Pierre speaks. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People like me? JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People with money. This is why I come. I help assuage their guilt when I remind them that there are children in this world who do not have clean water to drink, while they drink Champagne. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that works? Jean-Pierre blinks, then bursts out laughing. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take myself far too seriously. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm sorry, I didn't mean--. I've seen the pictures of the schools. The work you do is  ADMIRABLE-- JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm afraid I talk about it because I myself am not that interesting... (a hand on her arm) I'd rather know about you. ALICE (TRAPPED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well. You know. I...do what I can, here and there. A little volunteer work... She turns to her Champagne, rolling her eyes at herself. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, brother. Meg sits further down the length of all the tables laid e to end, beside Giorgio, who has pulled his chair close, draping an arm casually across the back of hers. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, wait. You're a man, right?  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 65. CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giorgio laughs. MEG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know: I'm funny. But, see if you can answer something for me. Ten years you're married, to the girl you dated in high school. I'm talking the girl you lost your virginity to, the one who gave you two great kids that you're just crazy about. Then one morning, what? You wake up, and out of the blue, it's like, "Oh, hey, honey, I think I'm in love with this other woman..." (PAUSES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His patrol partner. A beat as Giorgio shakes his head sadly. MEG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was his partner. Giorgio takes Meg hand, more in comfort than come on. GIORGIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heart feels betrayed. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (telling a secret) I feel like I failed. GIORGIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you this: A man...he will always love the mother of his children. Meg blinks, taking this in. GIORGIO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you must kiss someone else. MEG (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see-- GIORGIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To break the spell. You must! Then you will be free. A plate of beautifully arranged langoustine is placed on table in front of Meg. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 66. CONTINUED: (3) MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry, 'I didn't order-- She looks up to find Bernard standing in chef's whites. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, nods) Madame Kelly. He heads toward for the kitchen before she can say anythi Emma pours sloppy glasses of Champagne for her companions though playing a game of tag, spilling wine. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're my friend...and you're my friend. . .and you're my-- She turns with the bottle to find Nikolai who has materialized beside her on the long banquette. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey! You were at the party! Do you work here, too? Nikolai cheerfully shakes his head, holds up her purse.  EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Did I forget that? Wow, what a lifesaver! Thanks! NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ti takaya vaskhititel'naya. Emma sets the bottle down to concentrate on Nikolai. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not from here, are you? (OVER-ENUNCIATING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Emm--. My name is Cordelia. NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to himself) Nikolai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Jean-Pierre walk along, side by side, their han nearly touching, among the rest of the restaurant party. Alice looks up, taking in the bowl of pre-dawn sky, and glances over at Jean-Pierre who watches her.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 67. CONTINUED: ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stars are still out. Ahead, Emma breaks away from Penelope and Domenico, leavi the two to walk on together as she comes back toward Alic EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Meg? Alice looks around and sees Giorgio walking alone among t strolling party guests. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought she was right behind us--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernard takes a tray of dishes from his FATHER (70's, striking resemblance) who enters from the dining room. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa, sit down. Rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernard enters with the tray, stopping when he sees Meg examining a menu by the front door of the empty bistro. MEG (SLY SMILE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do cook. Bernard shrugs, smiling as he comes forward. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You enjoyed your meal? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adding the fresh orange; nice. Bernards nods, accepting the compliment. MEG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, a little fennel would've been "wow." BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time, you cook. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg! What are you doing? Come on! We're going to watch-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 68. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma and Alice stop short just outside in the street, pau as they sense they've interrupted. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were--. We're going to watch the sunrise. Meg hesitates, turning between her friends and Bernard. BERNARD (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should not miss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Emma walk with Meg down the narrow street at th end of which the party guests stroll and Jean-Pierre wait for Alice, with Penelope, Domenico and Nikolai. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy from the market? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is so cute! And a cook--! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chef . EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're single now! Meg slows to a stop, stands a beat. MEG (QUIETLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm single. I'm single, now. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Julia Child didn't take her first cooking class until she was thirty seven. MEG (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you that. PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming, Cordelia! The sun! 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 69. is EXT. PLACE DE CASINO -- DAWN Alice, Emma and Meg, arms linked, round the corner into t square with the rest of the party guests, just as the ver edge of the sun crests the horizon of the open sea. Alice turns to Meg and Emma, sharing this moment so far beyond anything they could have dreamed. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd be getting up now. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we were home. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, we're not. PHOTOGRAPHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia! The spell is broken by a TRIO OF PAPARAZZI who spring to by the hotel's entrance. PAPARAZZI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia! Cordelia! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good! I want a picture! Of the three of us! All of us! The paparazzi swarm from the steps towards Emma. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the fountain! She runs for the sprays of water, pulling Alice and Meg, the paparazzi meet them, flashing away. Leaning against the fountain's balustrade, Emma gestures everyone to join them. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penelope! Come on. I want one with everybody! Penelope, Domenico and Jean-Pierre join with other member the group and Emma lines them all up. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! Ready? One, two--  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 70. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots Nikolai observing at a short distance.  EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait! Niki! He shakes his head, bashful, but Emma gestures him over, swinging her arms wildly. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai, you, too! I need all my friends--Whoops! Her feet zip out from beneath her and she sails backwards over the balustrade, reaching for Alice and Meg, pulling with her as the camera's flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 747 airliner touches down on the tarmac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice's repaired suitcase tumbles off the conveyer belt.  RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Pardon me. Richard skirts around a man with a newspaper to retrieve bag and heads for customs. As Richard exits, the man folds his newspaper to its bold headline: SCOTT MAKES A SPLASH!, and a huge photograph of Emma, Alice and Meg laughing together in the fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma enters from the bedroom in a swimsuit and wrap, to f Alice hanging up the desk phone. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, have you seen my sandals? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, there's a two o'clock and a four o'clock train to-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Train? Where are you going? Alice looks up and takes in Emma's costume.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 71. CONTINUED: ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the beach. With Penelope. Meg enters through the suite's door carrying a bakery bag MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast is here! There's this fantastic bakery around the corner. I've already had three brioche. And I saw the greatest little shop for the kids, but they weren't open YET--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Alice's look) What's going on? (TO EMMA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. She's talking about train schedules... Emma trails off as she and Meg and Alice look between eac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: other in confusion, each processing for a beat. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to start packing, right? If we're going back to Paris-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to Paris? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the plan-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What plan? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not staying for the auction? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were just going to come down, take a look around and-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was before we knew it was for a charity. Remember the kids?  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 72. CONTINUED: (2) EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Africa. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ones we stole a trip from? The kids who are paying for this room? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, what's with you? We'll pay for the room-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're rich! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I'm the only one worried about the fact that we're lying to everyone we've met? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying? To who? Jean-Pierre? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who said we had to go to the casino--  ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now I'm apparently the only who's worried we might get caught. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in Iceland. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of her friends is bound to find out, or her family-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What friends? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got friends. The doorbell rings and they turn their heads in unison, t look to each other with sudden alarm. A beat. Emma goes to the door, finding Penelope, also dressed for beach, who holds up the newspaper with it's fountain phot  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 73. CONTINUED: (3) PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my god! We look great! (ushers Penelope in) Alice, look! Alice takes the paper, Meg reading over her shoulder. MEG (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have got to get that in the yearbook. PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yearbook? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penelope, could you excuse us? PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. of course. Where--? Alice shows Penelope to the bedroom, closes the door and spins to face Emma and Meg.  ALICE (HUSHED PANIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what I'm talking about! This is why we have to go-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't it mean we have to stay? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is so typical. Just because it's not on your map, 'cause you didn't plan it--. We all agree to take this adventure and then you won't jump. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't--? Jump? Meg drops into a chair, mumbling an aside to herself. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know how Richard must feel. Alice comes to a full stop and gapes at Meg, stung.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 74. CONTINUED: ( 4) ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard...? MEG (FEEBLE APOLOGY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying... ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're sure one to talk. Meg's eyes flick up to Alice. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't even bring yourself to buy a pair of jeans anymore-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you know what? Let's just pack. It's not fun anymore. Alice, if you think we should go, then that's what we're gonna do. You're in charge. Meg scoffs, an exasperated exhale. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. Not anymore I'm not. You want to go to the beach? Go to the beach. You want to go the market? Go! "Liberte, egalite, fraternite!" EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? Alice snatches up her purse and heads for the door. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means everyone should do exactly what they want. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, wait! Where are you--? You're not going back to Paris--? ALICE (RIGHTEOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? No. I'm going to have an adventure.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 75. CONTINUED: (5)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits, slamming the door behind her. A beat. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Emma's look) Don't look at me like that. The door opens, and Alice re-enters, striding across the for the desk, not looking at either Emma or Meg. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just--. My guide book. She picks up her book and crosses back to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard steps from the hotel with a MANAGER (50's) who pantomimes that he recognizes Alice from the snapshot Ric shows him, but has no idea where she could be. Richard pulls out a map to point at a random spot and the manager gestures up the street, down the street, shruggin She could be anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, amid a crowd of tourists, only half watches the changing of the guards outside the palace gates. She snaps herself out of her distraction with a shake of head and turns to the marked pages in her guide book. CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice? She glances up to find Carl and Deedee from the tour. DEEDEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thought that was you! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Carl! Deedee! Alice is surprisingly overcome and impulsively throws her arms around both of them. DEEDEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're sure surprised to see you, too!  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 76. CONTINUED: ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, what are you doing here? How did you--? CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when we saw how you stood up to that Madame Valery--! If Alice can do that, we thought, what the heck's holdin' us back? This is our honeymoon! DEEDEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was scared, but then, well, you only live once! And as long as we've got each other-- CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got everything, right? Alice blinks, unaccountably teary eyed. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. That's right. CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes you've just gotta follow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: your heart. Be bold: Let the rest take care of itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard stands with his map beneath the arch where all ro come together in a spinning roundabout of bleating car ho He looks down the length of the Champs Elysees, overwhelm The Japanese couple from Notre Dame approach Richard to a directions and he shrugs helplessly, pressing the map on them, and steps out as a crosswalk signal turns to green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice embraces Deedee and Carl beside a waiting taxi. CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the girls we would have loved to see them, but-- DEEDEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Italy calls! And Greece! We're even thinking of hitting Turkey! Imagine! We'll send you postcards.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 77. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0 Alice puts her friends in the taxi, closing the door as Deedee scrolls the window down. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy every second of it! DEEDEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, too, honey! CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bon voyage! The car pulls away, Carl and Deedee turning in their seat wave at Alice through the rear window. Alice waves until they are out of sight and slowly lowers hand, standing alone in the street. A beat. Alice sighs and pulls out her guide book, unfolding a map she looks up to gather her bearings. She takes in the quiet street, the view of the ocean, the looks back at the map in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She straightens up, a new look of purpose on her face, an crosses the street to toss her guide book and map in the trash can on the corner, striking out unaided down a narr twisting street hung with vines and flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice rounds the corner of one street into the tight intersection of two narrow alleys in the fading twilight. She looks around,.cheeks flushed, hair pasted to her forehead, lost in a maze of dilapidated walled courtyards apartment blocks; home to the city's service workers. She hesitates, then forges ahead down one street until sh sees that it dead ends, and she doubles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice suppresses panic as she walks briskly up a steep al high in the hills, trailed now by a small stray DOG. She stops, turns to the dog that also stops then sits. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is Go. Go home. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 78. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and starts forward, the dog following.  Alice stops again, turns, and the dog sits. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't follow me. I have no idea where I'm going... The dog cocks its head in comment. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? Alice turns to climb the street's incline. The dog follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penelope, dressed for the evening, gets up from reclining the bed to join Emma who models a gown before a mirror. The two regard Emma's reflection, cocking their heads in identical manner at precisely the same time. Penelope draws a necklace in gesture, indicating Emma's b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: collar bone. Emma turns, lit by an idea, and pulls the'steel briefcase from its hiding place beneath the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg opens the door from the street, stepping inside, wear the sexy jeans she hadn't bought the day before. Bernards's father makes his way to meet her with menus. EMILE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one. He leads her to a table along the wall and holds out a ch Seated, Meg follows him with her eyes to the kitchen wher Bernard works furiously at the stove, tossing the content a sauce pan with an expert flick of his wrist. Bernard glances out to the dining room, seeming to sense before knowing he'll find her there.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 79. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0 Meg matches the broad smile that sweeps Bernard's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of strolling LOVERS draw Richard's attention as he massages his stockinged foot at a sidewalk table. He watches them stop, kiss, then continue on their way. A WAITER returns with Richard's change on a plate and Ric fits his shoe back on his foot, gathers his things to sta He stops when he notices the front page of a newspaper fo on a chair at the next table. He quickly unfolds it to the photograph of Alice and Meg Emma in the fountain, scans down to the caption: Cordelia Scott and friends in Monte Carlo. Hotel de Paris, etc...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice feeds the little dog a scrap of meat as she eats a kabob, seated on the curb by a street vendor's food cart around which ALGERIAN MEN lounge in plastic lawn chairs. The dog looks at her avidly, hungry for more. Alice holds her kabob stick out for the dog to eat, surrendering her dinner with pleasure. As Alice sips from a bottle of beer, a soccer ball bounce off the curb and rolls to a stop beside her. She looks up as a ragtag BAND OF KIDS call from the dusty across the street, asking for their ball. A beat as Alice regards the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma wears Cordelia's elaborate necklace, standing alone, within a throng of PARTY GOERS, all conversing in French. she nods and smiles absently, though she's clearly lost, of her element, when Giorgio approaches. GIORGIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Meg? I do not see her. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I... I don't think she's 0 coming. I'm sorry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 80. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma drifts away to the ship's rail where she turns to  survey the party, smiling wistfully at Penelope and Domen locked in intimate conversation. PHOTOGRAPHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia! There she is! Cordelia! The trio of paparazzi putter alongside in a small boat, peppering the yacht with their camera flashes. Emma looks out at them, without her usual animation. PHOTOGRAPHER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile, Cordelia! Please, smile! Emma waves, but can't seem to manage that smile. NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ty v poryadke? Emma turns to find Nikolai standing beside her in white t a piece of cake extended in one hand, a fork in the other Emma's eyes light up as if a switch has been thrown and t flash of a camera records her huge, dazzling smile. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki. He bows slightly, offering the cake. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work here too? You never get a night off... He smiles, shaking his head, hands her the cake. NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya sa-meey shas-li-veey che-lo-vek na zem-le, pa-ta-mu chto u me-nya yest' tee. Emma hangs on every incomprehensible word. NIKOLAI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vy menya panimayete? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Niki... I'm so glad you found me. 0
