dialogues.text: Seamus. He's ten. Built a website for his fourth grade class. Now he's got actual clients. And that's Finn, the prima ballerina. She'll be six in June-- Emile examines photographs of Seamus and Charlotte from M wallet while she refills their glasses at the kitchen tab and Bernard works at the stove. EMILE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle est coquin, oui? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, she's no chicken. She's not scared of anything-- BERNARD (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a chicken. He says, she looks like a rascal. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea where she gets that... Meg lifts her glass with a sly smile as Bernard brings pl of food to the table. MEG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, that's a nice word for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm open! I'm open! Alice sails down the makeshift soccer field as one of the kids passes the ball to her, chased by the others. She dodges and kicks the ball through the goal to score. Her "team" jumps and cheers, as do a collection of specta who have gathered to watch this tall red headed woman in summer dress racing around the dusty lot with a band of k ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Go!  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 82. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice races back down the field with her team, the little running along and barking from the sidelines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, she is perfectly safe. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. No. No way. Bernard straddles a beat up moped, motor running, as Meg shakes her head emphatically. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can not take you, if you will not get on. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to tell you? I'm not getting on that thing. Bernard fixes her with a level look, which Meg mimics. BERNARD (AMIABLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'est bon. Au revoir. He swings a leg over the moped, revs the engine. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg hangs on to Bernard as they zip along the beachfront drive and turns her face to the wind with a smile. She surrenders to the ride, the sheer fun of it, laughing MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you say "faster?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernard and Meg, flush from their ride, enter the kitchen through a back door, to be hailed by a half-dozen CHEFS crowded around a table littered with dishes. IS (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 83. CONTINUED: BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best chefs of Monte Carlo. They come here to drink and show off. The end of every night. HENRI (60's, a bear in chef's whites) lumbers towards the HENRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! No! We are only cooks allowed here! BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, but, this is why we've come! I have finally found someone who can teach you how to cook! (INTRODUCING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Meg, from America. (TO MEG)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is Henri, the worst egotist, my mentor. The two men embrace, merrily kissing each other on both cheeks, then Henri pulls Meg under his arm. HENRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to the table) A chef from America! Come to flip hamburgers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Pierre drives an open silver sports car full of PART GOERS down the twisting streets, when he sees the commoti and crowd around the dirt lot. Then he spots Alice running-around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice sticks like glue to a kid with the ball, maneuvers steals the ball, and doubles back in the opposite directi racing up the field as the crowd laughs and claps. She passes the ball to kid who drives it to the goal, sco Alice looks up from the game at the tapping of a car horn see Jean-Pierre honking in celebration as he leans agains the car with his GUESTS, enjoying the game. Alice stops to wave, and takes the ball full in the face.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 84. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Pierre's smile winks out as Alice drops and he races from the car as worried kids and spectators form a circle around Alice's prone body. The little dog licks Alice's face and she opens her eyes. She leaps up as Jean-Pierre crosses the lot. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm up! I'm up! Let's go! She sets off down the field with the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty and half-filled glasses, bottles litter every surfa along with plates, ashtrays, crumpled napkins. Emma sits on the lower landing deck, legs in the water, s in her hand, looking out at the lights. Nikolai moves his legs in the gentle current beside her, tuxedo trousers rolled, while he concentrates on working napkin into intricate folds. Emma turns to look back at the silent boat.  EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't seem fair. Leaving you to clean up all alone. (THINKS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll help. But, you've really got to talk to your boss. Nikolai laughs, shaking his head. NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya ryadom. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must get kind of lonely sometimes... Not being understood. (PAUSES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how that can feel. Nikolai holds up the napkin he's transformed into a crown adorned with flowers and the wire cages from Champagne co Emma looks at him, her face soft and vulnerable, open, as Nikolai places the makeshift crown on her head with care.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 85. CONTINUED: NIKOLAI (HEAVILY ACCENTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My princess. They look at one another for a beat, then simultaneously to the sea and the frail sky, awaiting the sun. EMMA (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get me. Nikolai looks down at his hand on the edge of the deck ne to Emma's, and turns it palm up in invitation. Emma places her hand in his. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg tries to follow the discussions and familiar teasing the chefs as they pass plates, goading her to taste. She looks over at Bernard, who smiles as he holds his han up at the scene, his boisterous friends, the food; as tho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to say "this is good, enjoy." Meg relaxes her shoulders and gives in to the spirit of t table, spears a bite of food and lifts her glass to Berna CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg and another chef, locked in a chopping duel, plow tho onions at a blinding pace, their knives flashing, creatin escalating staccato on their cutting boards. Meg sweeps her onion from her board to a pan, and slams h knife down in victory as all the chefs erupt with applaus Henri seizes Meg's hand, raising her arm in the air, and presents her with a bottle of wine. Meg turns to Bernard, beaming, thrilled, utterly happy, a the other chefs clap her on the back, shake her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Pierre opens the door at the top of the fire stairs, revealing the open sky, turning back to take Alice's hand  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 86. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What's the most amazing place you've ever been?

dialogues.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hard to say. There are many. Alice steps out onto the hotel's roof with Jean-Pierre's jacket over her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, Africa, then. How often do you get to go? He leads her around the maze of skylights to the front of building that faces the sea and the lightening sky.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Not enough. Mostly I am on planes. To the places where sunlight and parties make people generous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice's smile flickers with a vague disappointment as she leans against the hotel's crown beside Jean-Pierre.  ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That seems a shame... JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I can think of one place I have never been. It is in my imagination only, so it is very special. He places an arm around Alice as they take in the view. JEAN-PIERRE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is just a small town, in a vast, open space. Maybe in the middle of America. There are people there like yourself, who are kind. And children who have everything they need. Alice turns to Jean-Pierre as he takes a strand of her ha in his fingers, and they hold a beat, looking at one anot JEAN-PIERRE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my mind, it is bordered by fields that are green.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 87. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0 Alice breaks the moment by turning her head to search t horizon just as the rising sun crests the open sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai shrugs himself out of his formal shirt to stand before Emma in nothing but starfish printed boxer shorts. He lifts his hands: This is me. Here I am. Emma hesitates, then lets her gown fall around her, bare except for her panties, the necklace, and her napkin crow Nikolai pushes himself off the side of the boat at a run, hiking up his legs into a cannonball. SPLASH! He surfaces and turns back to the boat just as Emma dives with a SPLASH! She swims to Nikolai, pushing him under in a child's game and he pops up, spitting water like a fountain. They laughs and Emma loops her arms around him. A beat as they sober.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma pulls Nikolai close to her, and they kiss. On the landing deck, Emma's gown shimmers in the morning with Nikolai's crown and Cordelia's yellow gem and diamon necklace nestled among its satin folds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, still wearing Jean-Pierre's jacket, walks down the hall with Jean-Pierre close beside her, neither speaking. She turns to him when they reach the door of her suite. A long beat stretches, full of every possibility. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Dubai. I leave the day after--. What is today? Friday? I leave tomorrow. You could come too. You wouldn't need to bring anything. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 88. CONTINUED: ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But--. Jean-Pierre... (a near confession) You don't know me. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is why I ask. I would like to know you, Alice. Very much. Alice regards him a beat, then slowly pulls his jacket fr her shoulders. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before this, I'd never even been to France. Jean-Pierre blinks and Alice laughs, as much at herself. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. Just kept putting it off. Always managed to find an excuse. But, really, it was that I was afraid. That it couldn't ever live up to the France I'd imagined. And if it did... Then I'd never be able to go home. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, now? Alice gently places Jean-Pierre's jacket in his hands and steps near to kiss him on the lips. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, thank you. She turns and opens the door with her key as Jean-Pierre smiles ruefully. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For everything. Alice steps into her room and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard exits the plane, walking down a mobile stairway o the tarmac, carrying Alice's repaired suitcase. 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard stands at the information counter, conferring wit ATTENDANT in his broken French. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excusez-moi...I'm looking for the train. To Monte Carlo. Behind him, Cordelia strides through a set of doors to st directly at Richard's back as she searches the terminal a hisses into her cellphone. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Daddy, I'm here. No, I do not see a driver. Yes, I am looking! The attendant points over Richard's shoulder to an exit. Richard begins to turn in Cordelia's direction, but the attendant corrects him, pointing the other way. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merci. He picks up Alice's suitcase and heads off just as a UNIFORMED DRIVER approaches Cordelia. DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle Scott? CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been? The driver leads her away, neither she nor Richard having taken note of the nearby newsstand and its display of tod front page: Emma on the yacht wearing Cordelia's necklace

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg zooms the moped around the fountain a last loop, Bern on the back, before jerking to a stop in front of the hot Bernard steadies the moped as Meg climbs off. ME G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is me. Back to the old Grimaldi suite. BERNARD (WITH REGRET)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to open the restaurant. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 90. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as they face each other, neither knowing how to en the evening, how to say goodbye. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank your father for me? BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will, Meg. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Meg hugs him briefly, awkwardly, then turns for the steps BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Meg. Meg stops, holds a beat with her back to Bernard. Then she turns and marches to him with purpose, seizing h face in both her hands and kisses him passionately. She releases Bernard, who staggers against the moped, catching himself just before going over, as she turns aga for the steps, an enormous smile on her face. IS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice sits on the edge of the bed with the hotel phone, i looking out at the sparkling bay and anchored boats. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaving a message) Well, I wish you were there. Or here. I wish you were here, Richard. I do... Because I keep thinking, no matter what I see, I'm only seeing half of it. Because we're not seeing it together... Meg lets herself in the front door and heads for the bedr stopping when she overhears Alice on the phone. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Richard. I hope you'll be there when I get home... Because that's all I want. Alice hangs up the phone, so lost in thought she doesn't Meg standing at the door.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 91. CONTINUED: MEG (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Alice looks up, smiles to see her friend. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey-- (taking Meg in) Hey! You bought the jeans! They look great--! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearful, comic) Alice, I am so sorry! For what I said. About you. And Richard. I didn't mean any of it! I love you. I don't know how I would've gotten through the past six months if it weren't for you-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's okay. You were right-- (bursts into tears) Oh, Meg! I made a huge mistake! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha--? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard asked me to marry him-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. What? When? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him we should wait a week! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You didn't-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did! He surprised me! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice... ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd imagined him asking me a million times, but then when he did, I just panicked. suddenly all I could think about was the trip. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 92. CONTINUED: (2) ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I hadn't already been to France. It was like this wave, all the years, and chances I'd had but didn't take, they just crashed down on me: And I hadn't seen anything but the end of Lake Avenue. The only clear thought in my head was, "this guy is so wonderful, how can he marry half a person?" MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Alice. You were going. We were on our way. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he was asking me to make a choice. But, he wasn't. He wasn't doing that at all. It was me. Because I couldn't believe he loved me just for who I was. France or no. (PAUSES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I had to do was say, "yes." MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, Richard knows you... It might feel like it's over. But,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it's not. ALICE (CRYING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really ruined it this time... The suite's doorbell rings and they both look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice opens the door for Emma who stands up from retrievi the morning paper just outside the door. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands off paper) Thanks. I couldn't find--. I musta left my key someplace... (on a cloud) But, what does it matter, really? When I already have everything I'll ever need... Alice exchanges a look with Meg as Emma swans across the suite to tear open on the fruit basket, pluck out an appl and drape herself across a chaise.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 93. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is EMMA (CONT'D) Moooorning, Meg... (back on track) For the first time in my life, everything makes perfect sense, you know? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to follow you-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in love! I am! Oh, you guys, I'm in love with Niki... Nikolai... Nikolai. And, I don't care if he is just a busboy. Or waiter. Whatever he is... Alice unfolds the paper, taking in the image of Emma wear Cordelia's necklace. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's funny if you think about it. I could have had a prince. A real one. But, I wanted my Niki-- (a big bite of apple) Hey. Why are you guys crying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good news! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we said no jewelry-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No--? What jewelry? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Alice holds up the newspaper. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, that's a good one! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The necklace, Emma! Emma's face clouds as she distractedly reaches a hand to bare collar bone, then flicks her eyes up to Alice. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma, where's the necklace--?  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 94. CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma leaps up and races to the window, throwing the doors wide as Alice and Meg dash after her onto the balcony. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The yacht! There! I left it on--! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?!

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHERS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Cordelia! Cordelia! They look directly down to the base of the hotel where th trio of paparazzi call as Cordelia emerges from a limousi Alice and Meg look at each other, stricken. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey. What's she doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia strides across the lobby, passing WORKERS who se for the auction, and arrives at the front desk. A busy DESK CLERK glances up, brightening happily.  DESK CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle Scott! Cordelia looks at him with typical, withering disdain. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver was late. The clerk's smile falters, fades. CORDELIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? I'm checking in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, Emma and Meg race around, frantically grabbing clothes, stuffing them into shopping bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DING! The elevator doors open and Cordelia steps off with BELLHOP toting her bags, as her cell phone rings.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 95. CONTINUED: CORDELIA (ANSWERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three women scramble though the suite, collecting, straightening, smoothing in a blind panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bellhop stops outside the door with Cordelia. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beijing? Oh, I want to come! Will you wait for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK! Alice, Meg and Emma freeze in their tracks at the very center of the suite, their heads swinging toward the door when they hear the key inserted from the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bellhop opens the door, holding it wide for Cordelia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: marches in to the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .where everything, impossibly, appears to be in place. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can be there in, say, a day-- (TO BELLHOP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was meant to have a suite. (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, they've screwed this up as well--. Who else is going? The bellhop opens the bedroom doors, revealing the tower Cordelia's luggage, crowned by the reassembled fruit bask Cordelia, unimpressed, indicates the bags the bellhop hol CORDELIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put those with the others-- (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait! She spins away for the French doors, twisting their handl and throwing them wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia steps to the railing, completely unaware of Alic precariously perched atop the adjacent balcony's railing, back pressed against the face of the hotel. CORDELIA (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stavros is supposed to be here, isn't he? I don't see his boat! Alice carefully turns to Meg and Emma who look back her w desperate faces from the balcony on the far side of Corde where they balance with their shopping bags.

dialogues.speaker: BELLBOY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle? CORDELIA (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Majorca?! Hold on. She does a quick turn, marches inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bellboy stands expectantly by the front door. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? He nods, not quite with his hand out, but waiting. CORDELIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're done, you may go. The bellboy turns but hesitates in catching a quick glimp of Alice, fleet as a gazelle, as she passes the open door the balcony behind Cordelia. CORDELIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, you can go. He bows a retreat, backing out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice climbs across to the next balcony where Meg tries t handles of another set of French doors. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're locked!  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 97. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They each look about for a route of escape. Emma looks down, on the heads of the unsuspecting paparaz while Alice scrutinizes the facade above. Alice looks at Meg. MEG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Forget it. Alice laces her fingers together, turning to Emma. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma, help. MEG ALICE--- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're first. There's a door on THE ROOF-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shopping bags swing up over the edge of the roof, landing profusion, followed by three sets of gripping hands. Alice, Meg and Emma haul each other over the hotel's crow the view of the ocean and the yachts in the bay behind th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOAT DRIVER in uniform passes a captain's hat to Nikola who places it on his head as they speed towards the marin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg turns to get a gauge on the distant yacht as she and Alice labor with the oars of a fisherman's dinghy. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd they have to park so far out, anyway?! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One point five million Euros, Emma! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 98. CONTINUED: EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I was sorry! You think I would have worn it if I knew how much it cost? Busy fighting, none of them notice as Nikolai's boat pass fifty feet off their side. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I going to tell my kids?! How am I'm going to explain to Glenn that we're in a French jail? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the auction, Emma! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My kids'll be in college when we get out! They won't even know me. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of us knew that, Alice-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trespassing. Burglary. Oh, god. Grand larceny, by trick and  DECEPTION-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the children--! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Africa. I know! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm standing in a stolen boat! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sit down then! Nikolai's wake hits the dinghy, rocking them hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard steps off the train, with today's paper wedged un the arm that carries Alice's suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dinghy strikes the side of the yacht and the three wo scramble to their feet, grasping the side of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was right here! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I can't believe this... Meg doubles over, hands on her knees as Emma stands over empty spot on the landing. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you even sure you took it off? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definite "yes." ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Were you this close to the edge? I mean, it could've fallen-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not even say it! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0 You know, I'm getting a little tired of this. Just because I SOMETIMES FORGET-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma, we're not talking about a pair of sunglasses! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have time for this! Let's just split up! Alice you go fore, Emma take the aft, and I'll check the cabin. Emma glares at Alice with steely, narrowed eyes. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Fine. (PAUSES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way is aft?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clerk looks up as Nikolai arrives at the front desk. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 100. CONTINUED: NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya khotel by perepisyvat'sya s vami. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excusez moi, monsieur?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, Meg and Emma reconvene in the cabin's salon, each coming from a different direction. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice boat. No necklace. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he, anyway? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just works here. I don't-- (an idea forming) You don't think he could have taken it, do you? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows?! I mean, is there  anyone who understands a word he says?! EMMA (STRICKEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this could all be my fault! He probably thought he needed it, to finance our new life together. The temptation was just too much for HIM-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma, it's your fault because you wore it in the first place! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He works like fifteen jobs already! You don't know what it's like being around rich people all the time-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, we do. IS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai picks up the hotel phone as he removes Emma's roo key from his pocket. NIKOLAI (TO OPERATOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pozhalujsta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORDELIA (INTO CELL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gratitude, Mummy. That's what I'm talking about. It's just so unfair the way Daddy assumes I've nothing better to do than-- The hotel phone rings, interrupting her complaint. CORDELIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. She picks up the ringing telephone at the desk. CORDELIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What? (LISTENS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot understand you. She hangs up, heads for the fruit basket with her cell. CORDELIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mummy, Mummy, I'm just saying I wish someone, anyone, would consider my feelings. Just once. She snatches up an apple from the basket without looking. CORDELIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go ask him how much he thinks a simple "thank you" might cost. She hangs up her cell with a sniff and raises the apple, stopping when she sees where Emma has eaten. She recoils, dropping the apple, which rolls across the carpet and hits one of Emma's sandals beneath the desk. Cordelia approaches, looking down to discover the other sandal in the wastebasket, along with Emma's broken plast tiara, room service dishes, and the newspaper. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 102. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia pulls the newspaper from the trash, curiosity  turning to shock as she takes in the huge torn photograph Emma wearing her necklace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women paddle back towards the Marina. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're just going to have to talk to her. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, that was the first thing that struck me about her. How reasonable she seemed-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seizing on the idea) Yeah, we'll just explain. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have sailed that yacht right back to Wisconsin-- EMMA IS (SELLING HERSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it was an accident. This whole THING-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think she'd fit in one of those trunks of hers--? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just thinking out loud. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never know. She might understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia slams the steel briefcase onto the bad, scrabbli at the combination lock. CLICK! She rips the lid open to reveal the empty velvet lining and she SCREAMS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard pays a taxi driver, taking Alice's repaired suitc and mounts the steps directly behind Domenico escorting Penelope through the revolving door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domenico and Penelope head for the ballroom entrance and Richard arrives at the front desk, just as the clerk's ph begins to ring. Richard holds up the newspaper with Emma's photo. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to find this woman-- The clerk puts up a finger as he lifts the receiver. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Une moment, Monsieur. Pardon. Behind Richard, Nikolai crosses from the bank of house ph for the elevator, stopping to pluck a flower from the lob arrangement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on hotel phone) Send security! Immediately! This is Cordelia Winthrop Scott. I've been robbed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai steps into the elevator, the doors closing, just Alice, Emma and Meg throw themselves through the lobby's revolving door. At the desk, the clerk hangs up one phone to pick up anot stalling Richard again with his finger. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon. (INTO PHONE) SECURITE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clerk stops, spotting Emma as she, Alice and Meg, spr past the front desk and Alice wipes out, tripping over he own suitcase on the floor beside Richard.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 104. CONTINUED: ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Richard whips around to see Alice spread-eagled on the ma floor as Meg and Emma slide to a stop. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice? MEG ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard! Richard--? RICHARD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! Richard! Richard drops down to help Alice as she struggles up, diz finding her feet to stand. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, are you alright--? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got my message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs Richard tightly. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no idea where you were. I looked all over Paris, but, I COULDN'T FIND-- (NOW HEARING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What message? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went all the way to Paris? RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week's an awfully long time. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Longer in France. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excusez moi, Mademoiselle Scott? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Francois! How are you--?  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 105. CONTINUED: (2) CLERK (UTTERLY CONFUSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You--? You still need security? Alice and Meg's heads swing in the clerk's direction. CLERK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are still robbed? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! (dials it down) A misunderstanding. We're fine. She's fine. (TO EMMA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fine, right? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super fine. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, we've got to-- (sighs, in love) I can't believe you're here--! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, we've got a little situation-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Alice's arm) It'll just take a minute! We'll have her right back! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about a thing! RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up newspaper) Like this? ALICE (KISSES RICHARD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll explain everything! I promise! They take off for the elevator. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy! Does he love you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 10 6. CONTINUED: (3) ALICE  (GLEEFUL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see he fixed my suitcase?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai rings the doorbell.

dialogues.speaker: CORDELIA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, thank god! Cordelia opens the door to Nikolai, who holds out the roo key and flower with a smile as her brows come together. NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lechu k tebe na krylyah lyubvi. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security? They look at each other in confusion, Nikolai's smile fad Cordelia with mounting alarm. She slams the door in his face. At the end of the hall, the elevator doors open for Alice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma and Meg, as Nikolai removes the necklace from his po and reaches to ring the suite's bell again. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The necklace! MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch that bell! They race down the hall towards Nikolai, who gapes, perpl by the sight of Emma. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Niki! I knew it! I knew it! I believed in you the whole time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia hides behind the drapes with the hotel phone. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Police! This is Cordelia Winthrop Scott.  (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 107. CONTINUED: CORDELIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Grimaldi Suite at the Hotel de Paris. You must come straight away. I've been robbed! And now some horrible, foreign man--! I believe someone is trying to kill me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma kisses Nikolai as she pushes him onto the elevator. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait for me in the lobby, sweetie. Down in half a second-- NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya tebya lyublyu. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Me, too. The doors close and Emma sprints back down the hall to Al and Meg at the door. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! Do it! Alice rings the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia approaches the door cautiously and spies through peep hole at the back of Meg's head. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? Who is it? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice dropped low) Security, Madame. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally--! She opens the door. A beat where Cordelia focuses on Alice and Meg first, possibly remembering them, then she registers Emma. She blinks, completely nonplussed. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open and Nikolai steps off just as the revolving door begins to spin, spitting uniformed POLICE OFFICERS and their CAPTAIN into the lobby. The clerk looks up and hustles around the desk to meet th CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon? Is there a problem--? POLICE CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We received a report of an attempted murder in the Grimaldi Suite. Cordelia Scott-- Richard, sitting nearby, looks up at the mention of Cordelia's name, at the same time that Nikolai takes a se at the far end of the same sofa. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. It is robbery. But, Mademoiselle Scott said it wasn't. Jean-Pierre, checking lists at the ballroom's entrance, n the commotion and Cordelia's name, joins the group.  JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. What's--? Mademoiselle Scott has been robbed? CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She said, not. POLICE CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said someone was trying to kill her! We are going up! Richard seems to debate getting involved as the police, t clerk and Jean-Pierre head for the elevators. Looking over, he notices Nikolai, who smiles and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can save your "sorrys" for the POLICE-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police--?  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 109. CONTINUED: CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You robbed me! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, the necklace is right here--! CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole from me--! EMMA ONLY BORROWED-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't taken anything-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, we dry-cleaned the dresses-- Meg and Alice wince, look daggers at Emma. CORDELIA (ICY DISGUST)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wore my clothes? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... For the children. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha--? What children? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Africa. ALICE (IMPATIENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole thing is for charity. Your necklace is for the auction. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there will certainly be no AUCTION NOW-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, that's not fair! It's not the CHILDREN'S FAULT-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you weren't here. Everyone thought she was you--  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 110 CONTINUED: (2) CORDELIA  (INCREDULOUS LAUGH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought she was me? Who could possibly believe--? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all did. Cordelia looks at Alice a beat as this lands with her. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drives it home) Every one of them. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, look at you! Emma takes a step towards her doppelganger, facing off. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look at you! ALICE EMMA-- CORDELIA  (DRIPPING CONTEMPT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Common country cows playing dress up. Pretending to be something you're not. Trying to be something that not one of you could ever hope TO BE-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean miserable? Cordelia blinks. EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or a petty, spoiled, selfish-- CORDELIA (REELS BACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You--! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch! Cordelia slaps Emma across the face. Alice and Meg gasp and they all stand a beat in shock.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 111. CONTINUED: (3)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma raises a hand to cup her cheek as Alice and Meg turn slowly to Cordelia, their faces set like warrior masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DING! The elevator doors open and the police spill out, followed by the clerk and Jean-Pierre. They hear a SCREAM! and break into a run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice shoves Cordelia roughly into a chair, thrusting her back down as she tries to struggle up, points at Emma. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You apologize to her right now! CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apologize--?! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I feel sorry for you-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia scoffs and Alice leans over her, menacing. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because no matter where you go, no matter where you jet to in this world, you are still going to be you. (points to Emma) And, let me tell you; she is who you want to be! The all freeze when a BANGING erupts at the door.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle Scott? It is the police! Open up! Alice claps a hand over Cordelia's mouth, looks to Meg. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouths the words) The police? 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police captain pounds on the door again, motioning fo the clerk to use his pass key. POLICE CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle? Open this door!

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Coming! Just a moment, please! The captain grabs the key from the clerk and turns the handle, just as Alice coolly opens the door from within. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bon jour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police enter, followed by Jean-Pierre and the clerk. ALICE (FEIGNED SURPRISE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia, it's the police. Emma turns her head from the mirror she faces.  EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no! This is going to be so embarrassing. Please tell me you didn't run all the way over here just for me. POLICE CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said there was someone trying to kill you-- CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a robbery, but, no. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, what's going on? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A terrible misunderstanding. You see, she couldn't find her necklace. JEAN-PIERRE (PANICKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, you have it? IS (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 113. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma turns, holding the necklace up to her throat. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but, Jean-Pierre, would you be a dear and help me? I can't seem to manage the clasp. Jean-Pierre senses something amiss, but steps to assist E POLICE CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard a scream-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she found it-- EMMA JUST NOW-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was so happy-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relieved! I screamed with delight. POLICE CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there is no one that wants to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: kill you? EMMA (LIGHTLY JOKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't speak to that. POLICE CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said on the phone-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said she would die. If she didn't find it-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The necklace! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Alice turns her brightest smile to the captain. POLICE CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is the necklace? For the auction?  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 114. CONTINUED: (2) JEAN-PIERRE  (CHECKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. He looks back and forth between Alice and Emma. JEAN-PIERRE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very lucky. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extremely! Think of all the schools we'll build! (to charm captain) Do you like it? POLICE CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (falling for it) Allow me to escort you, Mademoiselle. As a precaution. Emma, spots one officer poking his way toward the bedroom EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seizes captain's arm) Oh, but, yes! Would you? What an entrance I'll make! So dramatic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, are you coming, dear? Jean-Pierre takes Alice's elbow as Emma leads the captain the rest of the group from the suite. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me just grab my purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice opens the door as narrowly as possible. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay in here? Meg sits on top of Cordelia who is tied to a chair with a scarf, the fruit-basket apple jammed in her mouth. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're great. But, now you can add KIDNAPPING-- ALICE (RE: CORDELIA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't tell her that. Throw me a purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DING! Richard and Nikolai both look up as the elevator do open and Emma emerges led by the police captain. Nikolai leaps up. NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moy angelochek? Richard jumps up when he sees Jean-Pierre escorting an anxious Alice from the rear of the battalion. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice? Alice winces as she sees Richard approaching, at the same time Nikolai rushes to Emma. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki, I'm sorry. It's just going to another minute. NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya sdelayu vsyo, chto smogoo--  EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect! That sounds good. Emma is led to the ballroom by the captain as Richard mee Alice and Jean-Pierre in the center of the lobby. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quick, preemptive) Richard, this is Jean-Pierre, Jean- Pierre this is Richard, my fiance-- RICHARD JEAN-PIERRE (BLINKS) (BLINKS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiance? Fiance? Jean-Pierre offers his hand to shake, smiling knowingly. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh... A pleasure to meet you. You've come for the auction--? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! He came all this way! Richard tightens his grip on Jean-Pierre's hand.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 116. CONTINUED: RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice? Who is this guy--? Alice breaks Richard's vice grip with a bright smile. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, that's Jean-Pierre! (TO JEAN-PIERRE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's exhausted! It's such a long trip! Richard flicks his eyes narrowly at Jean-Pierre. JEAN-PIERRE (DEFLECTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe we are ready to start. Shall we go in? Alice loops an arm through Richard's to follow Jean-Pierr but jerks to a stop when Richard doesn't budge. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something I need to know? Alice looks at Richard, reading his face, and smiles.  ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. There's isn't. She leads Richard through the ballroom entrance only to b stopped by an ATTENDANT. ATTENDANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon, Monsieur, invitation--? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's with me! As Alice pulls Richard through to the ballroom, Nikolai s to the reception table behind them, producing an elaborat invitation from inside his jacket. ATTENDANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Monsieur Ludovic! Welcome! As Nikolai is ushered into the auction with great fanfare the lobby's revolving doors turn and Bernard enters, carr Meg's bottle of wine. 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg, holding the apple, sits facing Cordelia, still tied chair, the two glaring at each other. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will never get away with this. MY FATHER-- MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, nothing would make me happier than having a little talk with your father-- Both their heads swing toward the door when the bell RING Meg jumps to Cordelia, stuffing the apple in her mouth ju as she opens it to scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernard looks up when Meg opens the door a crack. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernard...? He holds out the bottle of wine. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We forgot your prize. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I... She glances back into the room behind her, carefully obscuring Bernard's view through the half open door. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have come at a bad time? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, Bernard, that's not it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordelia kicks her legs against the floor, straining agai the scarf as she tries to overturn the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd invite you in, but--  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 118. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUMP! They both hear Cordelia's chair hit the floor insi and Bernard darkens. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think--. You are busy. I think now I go-- Meg reaches out to stay him with a hand on his arm. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Bernard, wait-- CLICK! Meg and Bernard both turn their heads to look down the corridor when Cordelia sticks her head out the bedroo door into the hall. A beat as Cordelia and Meg lock eyes. DING! The elevator doors open at the end of the hall, clo to Cordelia. She looks back at Meg for an instant then bolts as Meg le past Bernard into the hall. MEG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma models Cordelia's necklace on a stage for over a hun GUESTS with Domenico fielding bids beside her. DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bid is three hundred thousand! Alice stands just off to the side on the floor below, bet Richard and Jean-Pierre, with Penelope. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: so, they all think she's this Cordelia Scott because... ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for a school, Richard-- RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Africa. NIKOLAI (HEAVILY ACCENTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five hundred!  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 119. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the heads in the room turn with an excited murmur as Nikolai steps to the front of the assembly. DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five hundred thousand! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh,no... JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes ! EMMA (TO HERSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Nikolai smiles up at Emma as ANOTHER GUEST raises a Champ glass in bidding. DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five hundred, five hundred fifty thousand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernard races to catch up as Meg flies down the stairs. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Meg! Why do we run? Meg stops on a landing, turns. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernard, you should stop. You really don't need this. I may be going away for a long time-- BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To America? MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that. Look, this is where we should say "au revoir." Bernard smiles and pulls Meg to him, kisses her. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I must see how this ends! 0 He grabs her hand and they plunge down the stairs toget

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 120.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight hundred! The crowd applauds happily. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki. What are you doing? NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vsyo, chto ya de-la-yu, lish dlya. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't. Just stop, okay? JEAN-PIERRE (ALARMED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is she stopping him? ALICE (MISERABLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't have any money. He's just a busboy, but they're in love- JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Nikolai Ludovic-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He means no harm-- JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice. Lithuania? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He owns it. Alice blinks. DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bid stands at eight hundred THOUSAND EUROS-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No. Ladies and gentlemen, I'm terribly sorry, but, there's.. (TO NIKOLAI)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you can't bid on this, okay? (MORE)  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 12 1. CONTINUED: EMMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your hand down, and I'll be done in a second. Then we can go. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mon dieu! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma! Jean-Pierre reacts to Alice's "Emma!" as she breaks away. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice--! She climbs the stage to Emma before the baffled audience. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, he doesn't understand. It's like a foreign language to him-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it's not. Let him bid. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, he'll get in trouble-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine. Let's just get this THING DONE-- NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One million! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai! You cannot bid against yourself! DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One million Euros! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Stop! Stop! I'm sorry. I can't... I cannot allow this sweet, wonderful man to buy this necklace, because... (finds the courage) It is not mine to sell. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It is mine..  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 122. CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd gasps, stepping back to reveal Cordelia in the  center of the ballroom, backed by all the police, just as .and Bernard enter, skidding short when they see the crow MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shhhh-- EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merde. Richard, Jean-Pierre, Penelope, and Domenico all swing between the two "Cordelias," as Meg makes her way forward with Bernard. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrest those women! They are imposters! A wave of comment sweeps the confused crowd. PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Penelope steps up onto the platform, shielding Emma and A as the police come forward and Meg climbs up.

dialogues.speaker: PENELOPE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are not imposters! These are my friends! CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penelope Pignose?! PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, you were never anyone's friend. Alice takes in the escalating situation, steps bravely forward to the front of the stage. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true! A ripple of exclamation sweeps the dumbfounded crowd. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not who we said we were. We're... We're only high school teachers. From Racine, Wisconsin.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 123. CONTINUED: (3)

dialogues.speaker: CORBEL IA
dialogues.text: (turns to captain) There! You see? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd never been anywhere. And we took a trip, that didn't belong to us... Because, well, because you thought we were... important. And that she was Cordelia... Richard smiles at Alice, supporting her with his gaze. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wanted to help. MEG (TO BERNARD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never meant to mislead anyone-- EMMA (TO NIKOLAI)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or hurt anyone-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're very sorry. And, we're willing to face the consequences, whatever they are... But... She turns to Meg and Emma as a smile blossoms. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, this was our adventure. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it was an excellent one. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wouldn't change a minute of it. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for anything in the world. Richard takes the pulse of the frighteningly still crowd, hesitating police, the charged air in the room. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: one million five hundred thousand! The crowd gasps and Alice gapes at Richard.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 124 CONTINUED: (4)

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why not go big? PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One million six hundred thousand! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penny, you don't have to... PENELOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends. Right? DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent! We have a bid for one million six hundred thousand! Cordelia whirls to the police captain amidst applause. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you just standing there?! Arrest them! POLICE CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrest them? For what? They seem very nice. 0 DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One million six hundred thousand! Do I have another bid? CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They confessed! They're imposters! They stole my necklace! POLICE CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That necklace? But, it is here, no? CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kidnapped me! POLICE CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yet you are here. I see no problem. Everyone is very happy-- CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, but, I'm not happy! POLICE CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, but, this... (GALLIC SHRUG)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do nothing about.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 125 CONTINUED: (5) NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three million! The crowd erupts, giddy, their applause escalating. DOMENICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three million Euros! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai! No... ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma. It's okay. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? How can it be okay? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's rich. JEAN-PIERRE (LEAPING IN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLD! To Monsieur Nikolai Ludovic! For three million Euros! The crowd cheers, overwhelming a forgotten Cordelia as it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rushes forward to hoist Nikolai up on the stage. At the same time, Alice breaks through the throng to jump down and wrap her arms around Richard. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard... RICHARD ALICE-- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me home? RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anywhere you want, Alice. We'll go anywhere you want. They kiss as Meg finds Bernard who shakes his head with a broad smile, holding out the bottle of wine. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good. I could use a drink. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First prize. To the champion. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 12 6. CONTINUED: (6)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai takes Emma's hands in his up on stage.  EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared, shaky) Niki? What's going on? NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya das-ta-nu to-be zvyoz-dee. Emma nods, without any real understanding, as he indicate the necklace. NIKOLAI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is my gift. For you. Emma's eyes slowly come into focus as it all becomes clear-and she FAINTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Together, Alice, Meg and Emma offer an envelope fat with Euros to Jean-Pierre. They stand, with Richard, Bernard, Nikolai, Penelope and Domenico, beside a waiting sedan at the base of the hotel steps where the trio of paparazzi shoot away.  ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for our room. And the trip down. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest is for the schools. Jean-Pierre hesitates in accepting the envelope, but Alic presses it on him. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. JEAN-PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are all extraordinary women. (TO RICHARD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you much happiness. RICHARD (SHAKING HANDS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Meg turns to Bernard, holding up the bottle of wine, as Richard places Alice's suitcase in the trunk with their shopping bags.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 127. CONTINUED: MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come to Wisconsin, we'll drink this in my kitchen. BERNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They embrace and Meg turns with Alice to Emma who stands in arm with Nikolai. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Emma, you're sure about this? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you both as soon as I know. They may have to get a sub at school for a couple of weeks, but, oh, you guys, I swear it sounded like a proposal! Alice and Meg turn to Nikolai who grins and nods away. NIKOLAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Pierre closes the car's door with Alice, Meg and Ric inside, stepping back to join Emma, Nikolai, Bernard, Penelope and Domenico, who watch as the car pulls out. Together, they wave their friends away. Jean-Pierre shakes hands with Nikolai and kisses Emma, ti his head in farewell to Bernard, then enters the hotel wi Penelope and Domenico. Emma and Nikolai shake hands with Bernard, then turn and for the marina, trailed by one of the paparazzi while the other two pause to reload their cameras. As Bernard hops on his moped to zip away, the revolving d turn and Cordelia steps out, talking on her cellphone, followed by a train of bellhops and luggage. CORDELIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Daddy! It was a huge success-- She stops suddenly, as if struck, and her expression of perpetual anger melts away as she listens, blinks.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 12 8. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: CORDELIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (DEEPLY MOVED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you? You're, you're welcome. One of the paparazzi raises his camera to take her pictur but another places his hand over the lens. PAPARAZZI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not her. That's the other one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice sits between Richard and Meg at the departure gate, each lost in their own thoughts as TRAVELERS pass to and A long beat. A small smile finds its way onto Alice's face and she gen lowers her head to rest it on Richard's shoulder. Richard finds Alice's hand and squeezes it in his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg walks down the jetway in her skinny jeans, a bounce i her step, shopping bags in one hand, the bottle of wine gripped in the other, as though headed for a party. Behind her, Alice carries her shopping bags and Richard t Alice's suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "I used to wander aimlessly,/ Wanton my goal, grievous my plight./Your dear hands led me, guided me." Alice encircles Richard's waist as they walk, and he slin an arm around her shoulder, kisses her hair. FADE OUT. FADE IN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under a beating sun, Emma, dressed in immaculate white li holds hands with Nikolai as a MOB OF LAUGHING CHILDREN an their TEACHERS greet them outside a new Marchand Foundati schoolhouse.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 129. CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "Over the far horizon, night/ Glowed with the pallid hope of dawn./Your eyes' glance was my morning light." A YOUNG GIRL presents a length of brightly woven fabric, draping it over Emma's shoulders as Emma picks the girl u and the other children lead Emma and Nikolai inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bulletin board in Meg's classroom is covered in African fabric, photographs and letters, all under a banner that reads: Food Drive for Our Sister School - Zambia. The two students who had cooked their pot holders sort ca goods beneath the board, while Meg cooks, surrounded by t rest of her CLASS.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "No sound - save his own tread upon/The ground - to ease the wanderer's heart./Your voice encouraged me: 'go on!"' 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STUDENT carefully scoops spices with a measuring spoon, holding it out for Meg to add to her pan. She ignores the spoon, instead reaching to pinch some spi with her fingers and encourages the student who follows h example.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice moves freely around the center of the circle of des her STUDENTS have formed, reciting by memory. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Yes, my heart - dark, cowed, set apart,/Alone - bewailed its dire distress./Sweet love, with its all- conquering art." The entire classroom hangs on her every word. ALICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Joined us as one in joyousness." A beat as she and her class float on the last phrase of P Verlaine's poem.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 13 0. CONTINUED: AMBER 0 (HALTING FRENCH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle Perry, what was it really like? Alice refocuses to smile at Amber and survey all the face her students for a beat. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone should go. At least once in their life. (PAUSES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a whole world for you to see. FADE OUT. FINISH
